       Unger has an excellent extended discussion of the strengths and weaknesses of proposed scriptural
interpretations regarding the origin of demons as being: (1) fallen angels, (2) pre-Adamites, or (3) Noahic Nephilim.
Since I find the latter two more plausible, I will cite part of his discussion regarding the pre-Adamic position:

             The classical meaning of the term “demon,” especially as it is used by Hesiod, is taken as its
      essential New Testament connotation, despite the fact that Hesiod’s demons, as the spirits of deceased
      men of the mythical “golden age,” are tutelary deities or canonized heroes, and are uniformly good,
      while the demons of the New Testament are invariably bad. The obvious discrepancy is laid at the
      door of Satan’s deceptions, at whom, we are told we ought not to wonder, if, in a “heathen poem,” he
      commends “his own agents.” However, in other aspects of Hesiod’s account of the origin of demons,
      the advocates of this theory see a remarkable able corroboration of their contentions, in that it
      represents a perversion of a primitive pure tradition concerning the sinless pre-Adamite earth
      and the fall that engulfed it.
             The golden-race of men, created by the gods when Cronos ruled in heaven, corresponds to God’s
      creation of the pre-Adamite race of men, when Satan ruled as an unfallen creature. The peace,
      prosperity, and unmingled joy of the golden race is reminiscent of the joyous state of the unfallen pre-
      Adamite people. The decree of the mighty Zeus transforming the men of the golden age into demons,
      together with the simultaneous change in the heavenly dynasty, with the expulsion of Cronos, bringing
      to an end this age of undisturbed joy, is reminiscent of Satan’s revolt, the judgment upon the pre-
      Adamite earth, and the demonization of its inhabitants.101

      Dykstra reasonably rejects the notion that demons are the disembodied spirits of bad men, noting: “This is
the view of Philo, Josephus and practically all of the early Christian writers. We object because the scripture
everywhere represents the unsaved dead as being in Sheol and Hades and not as roaming around the earth. (Ps 9:17;
Ezek 32:17-24; Luke 16:23)” (KL 502). Symmetry would suggest that if the Adamic unredeemed dead are not

and all humanoids/humans created anywhere in the Gen 1:1-2 timeframe, whether they be Pre-, Mid-, or Multiple-

       Regardless, even though the proposition held by those like Pember that demons are the roaming spirits of

morally accountable spirits is highly likely. For instance, Pember states:

             Since, then, the fossil remains are those of creatures anterior to Adam, and yet show evident
      tokens of disease, death, and mutual destruction, they must have belonged to another world and have
      a sin-stained history of their own, a history which ended in the ruin of themselves and their habitation.
             And since a lord and vicegerent was set over the animal kingdom of our world, through whose
      fall deterioration, disease, and death obtained irresistible power over every living creature, so we
      should naturally conclude that superior beings inhabited and ruled that former world, and, like Adam,
      transgressed the laws of their Creator. (P. 35)
              Such, then, are the demons of the classical writers. Nor does there appear to be any reason for
      changing the meaning of the term in the New Testament. For may not these demons be the spirits of
      those who trod this earth in the flesh before the ruin described in the second verse of Genesis, and who,
      at the time of that great destruction, were disembodied by God. (P. 58)

Like Adam, per Pember, pre-Adamites were: superior to animals, morally accountable to God, susceptible to
physical death, and subject to spiritual death. Such inferences seem reasonable and would explain their physical
features and destructions. Yet, for these very reasons, Dykstra’s further comments do not necessarily follow:

      In addition to the physical curse upon the earth, another consequence of Satan’s fall was the death of
      whatever creatures God had created at the Gen 1:1 time frame and whom we believe were under the

      we believe to be Dinosaurs and other prehistoric animals as well as a pre-Adamic race or host of Beings
      who were the source and origin of Demons and of whom Lucifer was in charge, these Beings fell
      because Satan fell in similar fashion as “death passing on all mankind” because of Adam’s sin. (KL
      926)
       Though I am exploring the plausibility of pre-Adamite models here in MMP5 (especially of the Pre-pre-
Adamic variety), my preference for monogenism, as stated in MMP4, is still retained. From this monogenistic
premise, when Adam and Eve sinned, sin entered the human race for all humans because all humans are descendants
of Adam and Eve. The atonement is also limited to them and their descendants. As I asked in MMP4, if there was
more than one original pair of humans (so polygenism), then what happened when the first pair of humans sinned?
Did death, decay, and entropy spread to the other pairs of humans who had not sinned? Apparently so, since the
world was affected. Did these humans become subject to death, decay, and entropy even though they had not yet
sinned? Again, it would seem so if polygenism is correct. These humans became subject to death even though they
had not sinned! For such reasons, I found the postulation of other humanoids in our universe to be objectionable.
       To circumvent that objection in the present work, I am posing that the entrance of sin into the human race in
Rom 5:12 was limited to Adam and Eve and their descendants, which is the logical extension of RET statements
by others such as Gaebelein: “It was by the one man, the first Adam, that sin came into the human race and death
by sin.”102 (1) Any other unfallen pre-Adamic humanoids, if there were any, living off planet in some other part of
our universe would not have been plunged into a state of spiritual death because of Adam’s sin.103 (2) Any other

they did not become sinners. Doing so may have cost them their lives. If they were in Lucifer’s realm and chose to
remain faithful to the Lord, Lucifer’s forces would probably have killed them. After all, Jesus said that the devil
“was a murder from the beginning” (Jn 8:44). Unnatural death, decay, and entropy were introduced into the universe

             This is the hypothesis that one can properly differentiate fossil people (as “sub-human,”
      “prehuman,” or “pre-Adamite”) and biblical humans (or the humans of Genesis 1–11). According to
      this view fossil people, or pre-humans, died out before the creation of Adam, and thus the two, fossil
      people and biblical humans, did not coinhabit the earth. “Adam was a de novo creation possessing
      spiritual qualities these pre-Adamites lacked.” Although this view has been traced to the seventeenth
      century, its principal advocacy has taken place since the late nineteenth century. Fabre d’Envieu,
      Alexander Winchell (1824–91), Reuben A. Torrey, and Arthur Rendel Short (1880–1953) espoused
      the view in the latter nineteenth or early twentieth centuries. Its most recent defender seems to have
      been an English anthropologist, Eustace Kenneth Victor Pearce, who has identified Adam of Eden
      (Genesis 2) with the new Stone Age man, who was a farmer and breeder of animals, and the Adam of
      Genesis 1 with pre-Adamite man. Described by Ramm as a “having our cake and eating it” too theory,
      pre-Adamism nevertheless has its problems. Three texts have been cited against Pre-Adamism: “and
      there was no man to work the ground” (Gen. 2:5d, NIV); “But for Adam no suitable helper was found”
      (Gen. 2:20b); and “she [Eve] would become the mother of all the living” (Gen. 3:20b). From an
      anthropological viewpoint, how is one to tell when pre-Adamites ceased and biblical humans began?

        The advantage of Yates’ model is that it provides redemption for all the Pre-pre-Adamic humanoids. The
strongest argument in its favor is derived from Is 50:2-3. If this passage is indeed talking about God’s judgment on
the pre-Adamic Earth, then the redemption it indicates is seemingly connected with Pre-pre-Adamic humanoids.
However, this passage is not one of the standard go-to-texts for RETs. Nevertheless, Flynn does include it in his list
in association with the shattering of Krypton (p. 361). Given the plausible applicability of this passage to RET, I
amend Yate’s claim by posing a correlation rather than equivocation. God’s hand is not so short that it cannot save
humanoids in that He would make salvation possible for humans—the highest form of humanoids. Redemption was
not provided for humanoid prototypes or angelic archetypes. On the other hand, Yates’s view might be considered
a hybrid of fully human phylogenetic bodies with fully human monogenetic spirits resulting in a singularly human
monogenetic redemption. Even so, I am more favorably inclined to my model, even though it does not provide
redemption for humanoid prototypes. However, my model would be more consistent by denying salvation to fallen
Pre-pre-Adamites in that it likewise denies the salvation of any other sentient, morally accountable fallen species
God may have created in the beginning. For example, I do not pose that fallen insectalins are included in the offer
of redemption, though I would regard them as morally accountable sentient beings, thus created in the image of
God. For Yates’ model to be consistent, it would have to deny that any other morally accountable species has been
created in the image of God, which is admittedly a popular RET proposition.
        Making a similar proposal to that of Yates, Garcia believes that fallen angels cannot be redeemed and faithful
angels do not need redemption. But some angels who fell short of staunch allegiance to God and wavered in
choosing sides during the First World Age “would be required to assume flesh embodiment in this lifetime and
granted renewed opportunity to prove their allegiance” by being “born during the 7000-year duration of the Second
World Age” (World, 100-101, cp. 139). Major obstacles to such a proposal include the soteriological deduction that
God does not provide redemptive help to angels (Heb 2:16) and the misthological conclusion that the world to come
is not subject to angels (Heb 2:5) but to the Bride (which is a higher class of beings than angels).

and led him to take preemptive steps to prevent any humanoids from becoming rulers who would have replaced
him.
        As to anthropological distinction, I would accept the latest scientific conclusion that DNA would differentiate
them as nonhuman, even though fossils do not otherwise suffice for the differentiation. Quarterman confirms this
to be the case: “DNA remains actually older than 6,000 years (like “Neanderthal” and “Cro-Magnon”) will be found
to have no genetic connection to any people living on the Earth today” (Watchers, 29). Dill (pp. 327-331) poses
four possibilities for ape-men, such as the Neanderthal: (1) They were truly human since they used tools. He held
this position until recent DNA studies showed that “they don’t have human DNA.” (2) They were very sophisticated
apes, which he rejects because of their use of sophisticated tools. (3) They “could have been a variety of man-like
animals created by God…They were simply highly intelligent creatures that God placed on this earth, but
subsequently became extinct.” (4) They could have been “Pre-Adamic humans that God once created, or at least
something very close to human…and built cities….It’s possible they were human in many aspects but lacked the
character of being made in God’s image. In that aspect, they would have been more like very intelligent, very
sophisticated animals that had no concept of moral right or wrong.” He allows the possibility that they were under
Lucifer’s dominion and were murdered by Lucifer in a war “since he was unsuccessful in complete domination of
them.” I favor the last option with modification. How could Lucifer have murdered an animal? Dill’s supposition
that these pre-Adamic creatures may have built cities, withstood Lucifer, been killed in a war with Lucifer, and
been murdered by Lucifer should lead to the conclusion that they were morally endowed and thus created in the
image of God, though at a lower level than Adam. To avoid that conclusion, Dill suggests that Lucifer may have
monkeyed around with their DNA (Jn 8:44), thus raising their hybrid intelligence above the level originally designed
by God. This suggestion is certainly plausible, perhaps even probable. But to suppose that all highly intelligent pre-
Adamites were hybrids is improbable, especially if God created highly intelligent extraterrestrials on other planets.
If so, surely, He would have done so on this planet also.

do not. Some who adopt it believe the supercontinent may have broken up in a post-Flood geological disaster
(Gen 10:25). The more prevalent position among those creationists who do accept the continental drift theory is to
insist that the breakup would have occurred during the Flood. The reference to the dividing up of the Earth in the
days of Peleg probably would refer to a patriarchal division or the incident regarding the Tower of Babel after the
Flood. The working model adopted herein will be this latter creationist proposal. The continents were broken apart
by the Flood—either the Luciferian or Noachian flood.

in distortion within pagan myths. Mount Olympus would fit that bill. Might the pyramids of Egypt and the Mount
Olympus of Greek mythology go back to a common racial memory of a pyramidal City above Earth where the gods
dwelt?
       Today, Christians typically refer to these gods as angels. Yet the Bible repeatedly refers to angels as sons of

shaped-city above Earth that was inhabited by God and by gods (i.e., the sons of God/angels) could be misperceived
and corrupted over time into the fabled Mount Olympus: the home of the gods with one supreme God—Zeus (see
LTPW). Possibly, in his fall from Mount Olympus to Earth, Satan was perceived as becoming Hades, the god of
the underworld. In mythology, this was misperceived to be his lot. The Bible, however, calls him the god of this
world (2Cor 4:4). Thus, Satan is the god of this world, and other high-ranking fallen angels serve as gods of portions
of this fallen world under his command.

      man, who was formed and fashioned after God’s very own image and likeness (Genesis 1:26-27), from
      all his wide ranging predecessors. Some of them, like Cro-Magnon man, may have looked like modern
      man. Some of them may have even had extremely primitive societies, and built very crude communal
      dwelling places. But none of them, apparently, had the “spirit” in man which makes him truly unique
      among all God’s creations. As Elihu told Job, “But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the
      Almighty giveth them understanding” (Job 32:8).
              This spirit was absent from Adam’s predecessors. They lacked understanding. They were
      apparently like clay images, a potter’s vessel, upon which the Hand of the Almighty sculpted and
      fashioned their form, attributes, and being. But they were not fully conscious of their own self existence
      as we are self-aware and conscious. They were similar to “models,” made of clay. They were
      forerunners—they were, if you please, clay prototypes of true man. They might be called, in the strict
      sense of the word, “experimental models” which served a purpose and were then cast aside, or allowed
      to die out, much as all animals die sooner or later. They did not possess the “spark” of divinity—the
      “spirit in man”—which makes him unique and sets him apart from the birds, fish, and beasts of the
      earth. (BSW, emphasis his, 212)

the angels could have something to rule over and work with. This seems a likely possibility, but there must be more
to it” (BSW, emphasis his, 243).

a highly problematic proposition. Nevertheless, Shriner makes that very claim:

        Granted, one might try to circumvent my objection to the mortal-angel theory by arguing that angels are
extrinsically immortal but nevertheless not reproductive. However, since Adam and Eve were extrinsically immortal
yet reproductive, this counter fails to be persuasive.133 More likely, angels are intrinsically immortal and thus
natively unreproductive. Alberino is inconsistent when he concedes the latter point:

             The problem for theologians is that sensual impulses imply sexual organs and reproductive
      biology, which according to convention, angels must not have. In an effort to circumvent this problem,
      some researchers have suggested that the angels did not themselves have sex with women but instead
      possessed the bodies of men in order to perform the act or, alternatively, simply “incarnated” with
      male anatomy (which assigns to them the metamorphic powers previously mentioned). Others
      postulate that sexual intercourse never actually occurred and that the procreative procedure was
      accomplished through some form of genetic engineering.
             All of these theories, and indeed any that may be devised, fail to address the critical first cause—
      the children of heaven lusted after the daughters of men. How can spiritual beings, supposedly
      unequipped for sexual intercourse and incapable of reproduction, be subject to carnal passions and
      accomplish procreation? Do the sons of God even have seed to sow? Surely the fact that they
      impregnated women suggests that they do. Proponents of the genetic engineering hypothesis attempt
      to sidestep this conundrum by suggesting that the angels did not use their own seed to fertilize the ova
      of human females but the seed of other creatures modified in vitro. In the first place, this proposition
      evades the first cause—they wanted to have sex, a desire which would have hardly been satisfied in a
      petri dish; and in the second place, it dismisses the testimony of Enoch, who leaves no room for doubt
      as to how they performed the act. It is evident that Enoch, as well as the writer of Genesis, clearly
      means to say that the sons of God lusted after, copulated with, and procreated through human females.
             The methods by which the watchers accomplished the transgression are not as important as the

       Alberino overstates his case when he says that any theory devised would fail to account for how the angels
could lust for human women if the angels were incapable of sexual reproduction. In MSIH, I explain how this is
possible, and, as explained therein, I am not alone in my proposal that God designed such sex for immortals for the
purpose of intimate pleasure, not for reproduction. Accordingly, I would counter Alberino’s assertion by theorizing
that heavenly angels are equipped for sexual intercourse but that their male ejaculate does not impart seed. Indeed,
I pose a similar heavenly misthological sex for human couples in their resurrected, glorified, immortal state.
Likewise, because angels are by nature immortal, they do not reproduce. Their sex is not reproductive. Hence the
sexual union of neither angels nor immortal humans is that of a husband and wife, which would entail sex for
reproductive purposes. When a question was posed about reproductive sex in Heaven, Jesus gave a well-known but
commonly misunderstood response:
      19
        “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies, and leaves behind a wife, and leaves no
      child, his brother should take the wife, and raise up offspring to his brother. 20 “There were seven
      brothers; and the first took a wife, and died, leaving no offspring. 21 “And the second one took her,
      and died, leaving behind no offspring; and the third likewise; 22 and so all seven left no offspring. Last
      of all the woman died also. 23 “In the resurrection, when they rise again, which one’s wife will she
      be? For all seven had her as wife.” 24 Jesus said to them, “Is this not the reason you are mistaken, that
      you do not understand the Scriptures, or the power of God? 25 “For when they rise from the dead, they
      neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven. (Mk 12:19-25)

        As argued at length in MSIH, Jesus does not deny that sex takes place in Heaven. Rather, the Lord denies
that reproductive sex—which was part of the original mandate to Adam and Eve to “be fruitful and multiply, and
fill the earth” (Gen 1:28)—is a part of heavenly sex. Earthly sex is different from heavenly sex. Therefore, earthly
matrimonial sex does not carry over into heavenly monogamous sex. The latter is different from the former in that
the former is not designed to be merely intimate and pleasurable but also reproductive. Heavenly sex lacks the
reproductive attribute. Alberino fails to consider this possibility and instead poses a self-contradicting hypothesis,
postulating that angelic sex is reproductive since heavenly angels “have seed to sow.” So, if the male angels have
seed to sow even in their heavenly state and, at least “at one time” had female angelic counterparts, then, per the
logical implications of Alberino’s own speculations, angels must have been sexually reproductive amongst
themselves, at least at that time. His proposition that angels might no longer have female angelic counterparts begs
the question, What happened to the female angels? Moreover, NDEs confirm the present existence of female angels.
Chapter 3. New Jerusalem in Transition                                                                          Page 77
If female angels still exist (and they do), and if male angels have seed to sow (and according to Alberino, they do),
then angels are intrinsically capable of reproductive sex, which leaves Alberino in a quandary as to how to explain
Mk 12:19-25 and leaves him at odds with himself since he poses that procreative sex was a special privilege granted
to humans, not to angels.
       According to his angels-have-seed-to-sow proposal, one of the reasons some of the angels fell was so that
they could sow the seed which they already had before their fall. How could unfallen angels have seed to sow and
no place to sow it? If they had female counterparts, then surely those female counterparts would have been capable
of receiving this angelic seed and yielding angelic offspring. God would be a bad designer otherwise. Surely, God
would not have designed sexually frustrated male angels with seed to sow and not have designed female angels
designed to receive that seed and produce offspring. Alberino’s postulation stops short of following through on its
implications and thus ends in an implicit contradiction. In contradistinction, I pose that these angels fell so that they
could take a form in which they would have seed to sow.134 In their heavenly form, the ejaculate of male angels does
not have reproductive capability. They have no seed to sow. Angelic intercourse was designed by God for intimacy
and pleasure, not for reproduction. So, it was necessary for the angels who fell to adopt a physical form that would
give their ejaculate reproductive capability if they wanted to have offspring. Alberino proceeds to acknowledge this
very possibility:

             It is possible that in order to breed with human women, the watchers were forced to abandon
       some facet of their higher nature and affix themselves to the constraints of the human condition.

       likened to those of the Sodomites and Gomorrahites, who were in the habit of going after strange flesh.

       According to Enoch, the watchers in Heaven do not marry and are not given in marriage; that is, they are not
given wives, not merely because their dwelling is in Heaven but because they are spiritual beings who live eternally
and therefore do not die or perish. In other words, since they are immortal, angels do not need to engage in
reproductive sex in order to avoid dying off as a species. Hence, they do not marry. This text would serve as an
excellent backdrop for Jesus’ statement to the same effect (Mt 22:30; Mk 12:25; Lk 20:35-36). Indeed, it might be
the backdrop for His statement. Matrimonial sex, that is, reproductive sex, is ruled out. Wayne overstates the
implications when, in response to this Enochian text, he says, “All this underlines the doctrine of no marriage and
no sexual encounters in heaven.” Not so! No marital sex should not be equated with no sex. Even so, I agree with
the following part of his assessment: “Evidently, angels lost their transcendental qualities while on the earth; they
took on sublunary bodies so that they, indeed, could mate with human females.” However, other aspects of his
assessment are objectionable and unlikely. Following the Zohar, Wayne poses that the angels were originally
sexless, but with their shape-shifting ability, they could become human males and females and thereby mate with
humans “and likely with each another” (Wayne, Conspiracy, 41-42). The sexless proposition is groundless. For one
thing, as Alberino has noted, the presence of sexual lust presupposes sexuality.
       On the other hand, contrary to Alberino’s hypothesis. Seedless does not mean sexless. Just because heavenly
angels do not have reproductive seed to sow in their native state does not mean that they do not engage in sex in
Heaven. Alberino is inconsistent in his analysis because he is blending two models into one. Nevertheless, he has
done us a service by posing both possibilities for consideration, and he adds a further observation:

       It is interesting that the watchers saw fit to wed these women rather than simply fornicate with them.
       This procedure reveals that they were after more than sex. Apparently, they intended to procreate
       families within the covenant of marriage, almost as if they were hoping that the interspecies union
       might eventually be approved, or at the very least tolerated, by God. (BR, 146)

Wayne’s proposal that the fallen angels mated with each other might be plausible but unlikely to be their preferred
option once they left their heavenly estate and state to take a human form capable of reproduction. Angels would
not be able to engage in reproductive sex among themselves, even if they took earthly reproductive forms. Their
spirits were not designed for reproduction. They had to cohabit with a species designed spiritually and physically
by God for reproduction. Having earthly sex with one another, while possible, would not have fulfilled the purposes
for which they took an earthly, sexually reproductive form.

       If Earth was populated by millions of mortal angels who waged war against other mortal angels to the far
interstellar north of Earth, then we may presuppose those other planets were inhabited by mortal angels. This would
explain why our physical solar system shows signs of this war. Granted, I am not predisposed to adopt this mortal-
angel premise, but the fact that this war took place in our physical universe requires that intelligent life of some
physical type exists on various planets in our solar system. If such life existed in pre-Adamic times throughout our
universe, then surely it would still exist. Adopting a RET perspective leads to a logical inference of the existence
of sentient life on other planets. Limiting this life to immortal, nonphysical angels would be counterintuitive.136

Earth through interstellar travel is no problem for them. Much of our recent technological advances have been
obtained through reverse engineering crashed UFOs (BR, 238-246). Angels are also extraterrestrial beings with
advanced technology. Both holy angels and fallen angels have been using extraterrestrial spaceships since pre-
Adamic times. Contrary to Quayle, Alberino asserts that the postulation that fallen angels use technology because
their “wings have been clipped….is a logical fallacy” (BR, 253). I agree with Alberino. Both fallen angels and
unfallen angels use technology. Both sides of this war use warships, for example. Alberino is correct to assert that
some of the UFOs are those of fallen angels, some are those of holy angels. The Nordics (tall-blond-blue-eyed
aliens, both fallen and unfallen, are angels (BR, 253). “Their half-breed progeny…look like the Nordic” (BR, 254).
       Alberino’s entire book is highly recommended and very readable. I will only take time to highlight a few
points. The grays are “the antithesis of the Borg from Star Wars” in that they take over a planet by integrating
themselves into its populace “though hybridization and take over from within” by stealth rather than to “assimilate
every race they encounter into their own cyborg collective” by force (BR, 255). If the grays and insectalins are
controlled or allied by Satan and the fallen Nordics, then they work together to consolidate power under Satan’s
Apollo. If the grays and insectalins are working independently of Satan for their own nefarious purposes, then Satan
will present Apollo as humanity’s savior from the grays and insectalins (BR, 256-258, 286-287). Satan will use
extraterrestrial forces from Mars and elsewhere in our solar system as well as mile-wide motherships around Earth

       Are the insectalins self-aware, sentient extraterrestrials living on other planets? Yes, apparently, in Alberino’s
opinion, they are. In fact, he poses that they may have reached a decline in their DNA and need human DNA:

              In the beginning, we will use our technologies to mitigate the deficiencies of our genome. Gene
      therapies will successfully cure many genetic disorders, and minor cybernetic enhancements will
      improve certain physical and cognitive abilities. However, due to the quickening pace of degeneration,
      more extreme modifications will be necessary to counter the decline. As we inch ever closer to error
      catastrophe, it will become increasingly apparent that the human genome is no longer viable. Once we
      reach the end of our genetic rope, we will require an infusion of supplemental DNA from an outside

      insectalins invasion and then help to redress the genetic apocalypse we face as a species.

                It is possible that the insectalins have already reached this point, and they are using human
      DNA to slow the genetic decline of their species. As the whole universe of matter is subject to entropy,
      all living things are expiring together, including the grays. (BR, footnote his, 286-287.)

Of course, insectalins and grays are not the only aliens encountered in UFO literature. Still, these will suffice to
prove a point. Are such aliens morally accountable sentient beings? Surely so! Perhaps the grays are a recent
construction. However, the insectalins would be part of God’s original creation. When were they created? In the
beginning. They would be a pre-Adamic creation, part of the pre-Adamic sentient species. If they are morally
accountable sentient beings, then they must have a spirit that survives death, and that makes them accountable after
death. If that is the case, then one cannot use Dankenbring’s simplistic argument that man has a spirit that sets him
apart from other pre-Adamic beings in that they lack some such similar spirit. So what makes man unique?
       Alberino attempts to tackle this question: “Although mankind is not the only image-bearer on the block, he
is afforded a unique privilege—he is permitted, indeed mandated, to replicate the image through reproduction. The
chromosomes of the human species are encoded with the image of God, the seal of man’s authority on earth”
(BR 72). I concur that angels are also God’s image-bearers and that they do not have reproductive capabilities.
Although Alberino downplays the literality of Zech 5:9, he acknowledges that “the scriptures do not necessarily
preclude the possibility of female angels” (BR, 10, n. 26). In contrast, I take Zech 5:9 literally and insist that female
angels not only exist but have monogamous sexual relations with their angelic male counterparts, though they do
not reproduce among their kind (see MSIH).138 After all, even Alberino acknowledges sexual lust was one of the
reasons that the angels fell in Genesis 6:1-4 and mated with human women: “That the angels, the children of heaven,
could look upon human women and burn with lust for them is a shocking contradiction to the traditional perception
of heavenly beings….The meaning of the text is inescapable: the sons of God were sexually attracted to the
daughters of men and desire to copulate with them and beget offspring” (BR, 141). These angels desired to copulate
with human females not merely to beget offspring but also to satiate their sexual lust. Thus, I argue in MSIH that
angels were created with sexual desire because they were created as sexual beings. An unbridled sexual desire
among some of them led to sin. A bridled sexual desire among those who did not sin could be filled with
monogamous sex with their own kind: humans with humans, and angels with angels.
       In any event, Alberino correctly asserts that the angels could “deem themselves reproductively compatible
with our species is sufficient to overturn the notion that only we are made in the likeness of God” (BR, 141).
However, if insectalins can use our DNA to try to save their species in a manner similar to how humans will attempt
to use angel DNA to save their species, does this not make insectalins created in the image of God also? My
supposition is that just as angels and humans are both created in the image of God, although angels are presently a
higher order of being, so other sentient beings created by God were also created in His image, yet they are
presumably lower orders of beings than Adam was before his fall. In any case, glorified humans ultimately will be
higher orders of beings than even the highest order of the angels. A social ontological pecking order certainly exists

       Alberino’s postulation that Adamic humans are the only image-bearers who sexually reproduce is open to
objection, depending on the nature of other possible pre-Adamic image-bearers. Alberino continues: “The
hierarchical position of the human race is clearly defined. Man was not made to be a little higher than the beasts of
the earth but a little lower than the angels of heaven [Ps 8:5]. As a son of God, man was equipped with the same
sentient facilities of his elder siblings [the angels]” (p. 74). True. But are humans and angels the only sentient beings
whom God created? No. Even Alberino is inclined to acknowledge: “It is plausible that other sentient beings, subject
to Adam’s dominion, were also present from the beginning of his rule—the fallen stars not the least among them”
(BR, 99). In a note, he adds,

              “It is the author’s postulation that a pre-Adamic indigenous reptilian race may have inhabited

      planets in the solar system, the earth, with this atmosphere intact, would have presented the most
      inhabitable environment” (BR, 99, n. 25).

        Alberino is not only postulating the existence of other pre-Adamic sentient species but allowing the
possibility that they were concurrent with Adam on Earth and even ruled over by Adam. Furthermore, as already
noted, if God created other pre-Adamic sentient species besides angels, He would not have limited them to our solar
system but would have created them in other solar systems throughout the universe where other angelic princes
ruled. Since we know that both angels and humans were created in the image of God and that humans were originally
created a little lower than the angels, we know that being created in God’s image is not limited to one species but
can apply to multiple species. We also know that these species are not equal; therefore, we may safely conclude
that not all species who share God’s image do so equally. We further know that God is a moral being and prohibits
the murder of those beings created in His image (Gen 9:6) because to kill someone created in the image of God is
to kill God in effigy. From a GAP perspective, Satan being a “murder from the beginning” (Jn 8:44) means that he
was a murderer from the point of his fall—long before he induced Adam and Eve to sin. Satan killed beings created
in the image of God from the beginning. Either he killed fellow angels or some other beings created in the image
of God or both. Posing that angels are susceptible to death at the hands of fellow angels is very problematic because
of their immortality. More likely, Satan killed pre-Adamic mortals. Granted, Lucifer became subject to spiritual
death at the point of his fall. Thus, any angels he led in his rebellion would have been led to their spiritual deaths.
Satan might be a murderer in this sense of the word. Moreover, real angelic casualties exist in these wars between
angels. At present, though, I do not have a verifiable model by which to postulate that unfallen angels who have not
sinned are subject to spiritual death at the hands of a fallen angel. Like other writers, I can only theorize.139 For now,
we will work primarily with what we can rather safely infer. Namely, pre-Adamic mortals who were capable of
physical death were present from the beginning of creation. They could take part in the war and be killed.

       Although not followed through to its logical conclusion by all its advocates, the GAP position leads to an
affirmation that physical, sentient, morally accountable beings existed on other planets. We may reasonably
infer that Planet Earth and other planets throughout the universe were formed to be inhabited before the
GAP: “The earth was formed to be inhabited and was inhabited before the flood of Genesis 1:2 and the Six-Days
of Genesis 1 (Isaiah 14:12-14; Jeremiah 4:23-26; Ezekiel 28:11-17; and 2 Peter 3:5-8)” (McCrillis, KL 3976). When
Lucifer fell, he was cast to the earth/ground, and the Earth/planet was destroyed. Why? Because his merchandising
and rulership involved Earth and this physical dimension. Earth was destroyed by God in this act of judgment
because Earth and this realm were involved in this war. The texts used in support of RET demand that we
acknowledge that our physical dimension was involved. The state of the Earth in Gen 1:2 is a result of God’s
judgment on primeval evil. Sentient beings were inhabiting Earth and its surrounding planets. The texts affirm the
presence of their cities. The only real question is, Was this intelligent life on other planets limited to angels? Dill
believes it was limited to angels:

                                                  Whose Cities Were These?
             I know there was plant life, bird life, and I’ll even speculate about animal life on the Pre-Adamic
      earth, but whose cities were these? Why did God destroy them in His wrath? Why is God reminding
      the Jews of what He did to the Pre-Adamic earth? He’s warning them that they face the same
      destructive wrath. God is telling them that just as He destroyed the Pre-Adamic cities, He will destroy
      them, with the exception that He won’t make a full end to them. Who built these cities that were
      destroyed before Adam was created? Two sub-theories have emerged. The first is that “men,” some
      type of human or hominid creatures, existed before Adam. The other is that angels dwelt on the Pre-
      Adamic earth and built cities. Whether it was “men” or angels (or both) is unimportant as far as the
      Gap Theory itself is concerned. What matters is that THERE WAS INTELLIGENT LIFE ON EARTH
      BEFORE THE SIX DAYS OF GENESIS. There was a Pre-Adamic civilization. This means that
      Genesis 1:3-31 was not part of the original creation of the earth. Earth had an earlier beginning. I
      strongly believe that the six days of Genesis
             1:3-31 were six twenty-four-hour days. I am convinced that all life now on earth originated from
      those living things God restored during those six days. However, I am equally convinced there was
      life on earth prior to those six days and that Pre-Adamic life was destroyed by God’s judgment. I am
      also convinced that no living thing, including those things alive before Adam, got here by any process
      of evolution.
                                                   A Look at Satan’s World
             I am of the opinion that angels lived on earth and built cities prior to earth’s destruction. I believe
      it was Lucifer and the fallen angels who caused earth to be made desolate and the universe to groan
      under the power of sin. I believe this because the Bible tells us about a judgment prior to Adam, but it
      says nothing about humans. I know this doesn’t prove there weren’t humans prior to Adam, but if Pre-
      Adamic humans existed, the Bible is silent about them. (Of course, God has every right to withhold
      information from us if He wishes.) On the other hand, the Bible tells us about the sin and rebellion of
      Lucifer. The Bible tells us that one-third of the angelic hosts were pulled into that rebellion. God
      doesn’t want us to be ignorant about those rebellious angels. That’s why I think they were the ones

      no clues for understanding Jeremiah’s revelation. If the Bible tells us about sin and rebellion prior to
      the six days of Genesis, then it must be referring to the only creatures mentioned in the Bible who
      sinned and rebelled prior to those six days. It must be referring to Lucifer and his fallen angels.
      (Beginnings, 240-241)

       An argument from silence is weak; therefore, Dill’s preference for an exclusively angelic inhabitation is not
particularly strong. For one thing, the text refers to the absence of men rather than of angels: “I looked, and behold,
there was no man [adam]” (Jer 4:25).140 Why do some RETs pose that these pre-Adamite cities had been occupied

     That said, ayin is reasonably considered to mean not yet in the parallel passage Garcia cites: “There was not yet

cultivate the ground. But there were water vapors arising from the earth, which kept watering the whole face of the
ground.” Henry Morris, The Genesis Record: A Scientific and Devotional Commentary on the Book of the

cited, supporting Morris’ assertion that this translation is correct and indicates that “man had not yet been created.”

7/26/2021. Fine. I concur. Morris’ translation is perfectly acceptable, given a YEC premise. But if YEC can use this
argument to assert that human beings had not yet been created in Gen 2:5, then they should not fault RETs for using
the same argument to assert that human beings had not yet been created in Jer 4:25. CJB translates adam as human
being in this verse. Good idea. If we inject a yet, we get a perfectly plausible translation: “There were as yet no
humans” (TM). This translation is perfectly acceptable, given a RET premise. Humans (Adamites) had not yet been
created in either Gen 2:5 or Jer 4:25. As Garcia says, “Humankind had not yet appeared on the scene” (World, 43).
Nevertheless, this need not rule out the pre-existence of humanoids. The joint angelic-humanoid pre-Adamic
position is less problematic than an exclusively angelic pre-Adamite position. Indeed, on the same page, Garcia
acknowledges, “The earth was not created initially vacant but to be inhabited by those creatures which did exist
during the first world age” (World, 43). Adam and Eve were not given the mandate to replenish the Earth with
angelic image-bearers but with humanoid image-bearers, of which they would be the epitome (Gen 1:28). Talbot
correctly argues RET for replenish in Gen 1:28; nevertheless, like many, he fails to acknowledge that this implies
pre-Adamic humanoids. Louis T. Talbot, Bible Questions Explained (Grand Rapids, MI: Eerdmans Publishing
Company, 1938), 61-62.

       Granted, Dill is correct to deduce that the groaning of the universe was induced by Lucifer’s fall into sin,
thus predating Adam’s fall. Lucifer’s fall introduced physical changes in the universe. Cities were destroyed; at
least one planet was destroyed; interstellar wars were fought. Additionally, God may have separated dimensions.
Even so, this postulation is not sufficient to deal with the problem of pre-Adamic angelic sex. In addition to changing
the universe, did God change angels from being physical to ethereal so as to make them immortal and yet sexually
sterile? If some of the mortal female angels were pregnant at the time, what happened to their unborn angelic
children? What about angelic infants? The alternative sub-theory posed by Dill is far less problematic. Pre-Adamic
hominids built the cities and dwelt in them. In giving the pros and cons for the GAP theory, Constable (TCENB)
provides a summation for the classical GAP theory that adopts the hominid interpretation:

             Statement: The classic statement of this theory contains the following ideas, though there have
      been many variations on this theory.
             1. There is an indefinite time gap (hence the name of the theory) between 1:1 and 1:2.
             2. Verse 1 reveals the creation of a perfect heaven and earth very different from what we see
      around us now.
             3. A preadamic race of humans inhabited this original creation.
             4. Lucifer (unfallen Satan), whose “headquarters” was in the Garden of Eden, ruled over this
      race of people.
             5. When Lucifer rebelled—many advocates see this in Isaiah 14—sin entered the world.
             6. Part of God’s judgment of this rebellion was the destruction of the earth with a flood (in
      Noah’s day) followed by a global ice age, which accounts for the fossils. (Emphasis his.)

       Interjecting a Luciferian flood followed by its own ice age is an extremely popular variation that should
probably be inserted, making the Noachian flood and its attendant ice age seventh on the list. In any event, if a pre-
Adamic race of humans inhabited Planet Earth, as affirmed by classic RET, then it stands to reason that these pre-
Adamic humans inhabited other planets throughout creation also. The destruction of their habitations in this
solar system would not entail their destruction in other solar systems. An affirmation of the current existence
of pre-Adamic humans on planets throughout creation would be a practical corollary of the classical GAP
theory. For myself, affirming pre-Adamic humanoids is less problematic, especially when enjoined with
additional corollaries, such as affirming that (1) Adamic humans have a different physical DNA and spiritual
capacity than that of any other species and (2) only Adamic humans have the capacity to become the Bride
of Christ. Admittedly, in my contrarian opinion, pre-Adamic humanoids were probably created in the image
of God and thus susceptible to murder.141 Quite likely, other morally accountable creatures were likewise
created in the image of God and susceptible to murder as well.

       In Rom 8:20-21, Paul says that all creation was subject to futility because of sin, presumably Lucifer’s sin.
When Paul says that the gospel “was proclaimed in all creation under heaven” in Col 1:23 as a completed event, he
evidently is asserting that the news of what Christ did on the cross has been sent to intelligent beings throughout
the universe. Not only the angels but all sentient beings throughout creation have been made aware of what has
happened. The only planet not fully aware is Earth. Jesus’ orders for this planet remain in force: “Go into all the
world and preach the gospel to all creation” (Mk 16:15). The gospel of redemption is only applicable to humanity.
Nevertheless, the gospel is good news to every pre-Adamic creature fighting on God’s side in this war—a war that
has lasted eons. The end of this war and victory are in sight. The victory Christ won on the cross was proclaimed
by Him even “to the spirits now in prison” (1Pet 3:19). It has been proclaimed by His forces throughout the universal
kingdom. Earth is the only planet still awaiting full proclamation.
       “The idea of an independent proclamation to the non-human creation” is one of the three interpretations
considered by Wright (TNTC), but he finds it unlikely since “the notion of an instantaneous announcement made
directly to the non-human orders of creation” does not “find any echoes elsewhere in his [Paul’s] writings.” Thus,
Wright poses that “God has, in principle, announced the gospel to every creature under heaven.” In principle?
Hardly! Paul is not speaking hyperbolically, proleptically, prophetically, or principally, but literally in Col 1:23,
just as he does in Rom 8:20-21 and as Jesus does in Mk 16:15. Paul had just gotten through affirming that Jesus is
the “first-born of all creation” (Col 1:15). Paul then immediately explains: “For by Him all things were created,
both in the heavens and on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones or dominions or rulers or authorities—all
things have been created by Him and for Him” (Col 1:16). All intelligent beings throughout the universe, whether
they are part of the visible or invisible dimensions, are aware of the Lord’s dominion. They know Jesus is Lord. In
Col 1:15-16, Paul asserts Christ’s cosmic lordship. A few verses later, in Col 1:23, he asserts the cosmic
communication of the gospel as being universal. The gospel of what the Lord has done for humanity has
reached the furthest ends of the universe. The whole universe was waiting with bated breath to see what
would happen when Christ came to Earth during His incarnation to face off against Satan. News of what
happened would have traveled much faster than the speed of light. Angelic technology would have enabled
the news to travel instantaneously and universally. Both sides of this conflict were immediately informed of
the outcome. Can one seriously entertain the notion that there is an angel, fallen or otherwise, anywhere in
the entire universe who was not immediately aware of what happened on the cross or at the resurrection?

Edom
       In an extended discussion of the galactical battle, only summarized in part here, Alberino demonstrates that,
at one level, the nations of Israel and Edom represent earthly kingdoms; at a deeper allegorical level, they represent
the kingdom of God and the kingdom of Lucifer, respectively (BR, 74). The fallen Edomite kings are exoteric
references used to personify the fallen extraterrestrial princes and their planets. Alberino’s assertion that Satan
attempted to corrupt the genome (seed) of mankind in Gen 6:1-4 with Nephilimic offspring before the flood is well
received, of course, but his assertion that Satan sowed “the seed of Edom in the womb of Rebekah” after the flood
is speculative (BR, 52). In his opinion, Edomic offspring are thus Nephilim. Thus, in his assessment, Esau was a
Nephilim. “References to Edom in the scriptures are intended to communicate three interconnected episodes in
time: 1) the celestial conflict in the pre-Adamic past, 2) the terrestrial conflict with the nation of Israel during the
biblical period, and 3) the battle of Armageddon at the end of the age” (BR, 53). The Edom war described in Is 34:4-
5 encompasses all three dimensions: celestial, terrestrial, and eschatological. “All the host of heaven shall rot away,
and the skies roll up like a scroll. All their host shall fall, as leaves fall from the vine, like leaves falling from the
fig tree. For my sword has drunk its fill in the heavens; behold, it descends for judgment upon Edom, upon
the people I have devoted to destruction” (Is 34:4-5; ESV). This celestial destruction has a terrestrial impact with
apparent mortal results even in the heavens. The prophecy against Edom in Obad 1:1-4 includes the pre-Adamic
war among the stars fought against Satan (BR, 54).

Interplanetary Versus Intergalactic War
       Two basic competing models are offered by various writers as the nature of the interplanetary destruction:
(1) The planets of our solar system met destruction from the interaction of another planet that passed through our
solar system (such as Planet X). We can call this the planetary model. (2) Or the planets in our solar system met
destruction through a war. We can call this the war model. As to this latter possibility, (2a) the planets were
destroyed via an interplanetary war among themselves, or (2b) the planets were destroyed as part of a larger
galactical battle. In either of these two cases, it culminated in the Luciferian flood.

(1) resulted in comets from some of the larger remains of Rahab and (2) kicked Mars into a cometary orbit
until it eventually retained its planetary orbit. Farrell’s thesis is that “planetary wars…are the mythological
retelling on the part of legacy civilizations of an actual interplanetary war….fought between real people who came
to symbolize the entire planet” (emphasis his, 21). I modify this explanation to pose that it was an interstellar war
between these planets versus heavenly forces and their warships. This information could have been passed down
via the retelling by angels, fallen and unfallen, as well as their hybrid offspring and other extraterrestrials. Farrell
poses that artifacts “showing evidence of intelligent human presence on earth millions of years ago” indicate that

warships are not necessarily protected by a sufficiently strong force field to avoid damage and even
destruction from such a weapon. Farrell adopts Sitchin’s textual arguments for the Pyramidal Wars using ancient
Hindu texts, Ramayana and Mahabharata. These texts talk about flying ships (vimanas), some of which were flying

an instant” (emphasis his, 95). Archaeological evidence of apparent nuclear destruction of the Indus Valley
civilization, complete with radioactive human skeletons holding hands, provides confirmation that such weapons
were used in the past on Earth. Likewise, large areas of desert glass confirm the use of some type of nuclear weapon
in antiquity (pp. 97-98). A laser is a visible beam of coherent energy output. A maser is an invisible beam of such
energy since it uses the microwave spectrum. The Pyramid would have used the latter. The plasma energy it
generated would have turned invisible and turned back to being visible when it hit the target (p. 265). “Theoretically,
then, any target in nearby space could have been selected, from the Indian sub-continent, to the moon, or Mars”
(emphasis his, 266). Since “every object has a frequency that it vibrates or resonates to,” this weapon could be used
against any object (emphasis his, 142). “Any material would do to set off that reaction. Wood, steel, or plastic would
have been just as violently blown apart as uranium” (emphasis his 281). I would interject that Heavenly Jerusalem
is a literal city made out of material and surely has a harmonic frequency also. Its gold and gems could be
blown apart if hit unabated by such a weapon. If Heavenly Jerusalem were to appear above Planet Rahab,
it would be in the range of such a weapon. Therefore, Heavenly Jerusalem would have been susceptible to
this type of attack. Since Lucifer is an acoustical master of harmonics, he would be a master of the maser.

field is powered directly by God’s supernatural strength and surpasses all the power of the universe.
Intergalactic War
       Various writers follow the basic tenant of Farrell’s proposition of an interplanetary war. MMP4 had several
citations from his book, The Cosmic War: Interplanetary Warfare, Modern Physics, and Ancient Texts. In his 2020
True Legends presentation of Ancient Cataclysms and Coming Catastrophes, Michael Lake also gives a positive
citation of Farrell’s book.156 In Cosmic War, Farrell cites possible evidence of a nuclear war on Mars.157 And he
presents evidence that Planet Rahab was blown up as an act of war. He contends that planetary catastrophism such
as that posed by Velikovsky does not adequately account for all the scientific and literary data. A war must be
proposed. Otherwise, the data is highly conflated in that war data is misinterpreted as planetary catastrophism. Thus,
Farrell juxtaposes the catastrophic school of thought with the real-war school of thought. In my opinion, both
schools of thought have their place. The cosmic war resulted in planetary catastrophism. Therefore, if one
simply follows Farrell’s war hypothesis, a moderate amount of conflation still ensues in that planetary catastrophism
data is misinterpreted as war data. One must place the Noachian flood later, as Farrell acknowledges: “Author
Stephen Quayle rightly notes that this creation account appears to record the destruction by fire of one civilization
that occurred before the Genesis account, a civilization that obviously would be ‘pre-Adamic’, and then recorded
the destruction of another civilization by the Flood” (War, 93). Unfortunately, Farrell does not cite his reference to
Quayle’s destruction-by-fire hypothesis. Since Farrell’s other citations in Wars is to Quayle’s book, Giants, I
consulted Quayle’s discussion for myself to investigate this pre-Adamic destruction-by-fire hypothesis.

Adamic civilization was wiped out by a comet, presumably a fiery comet, and considers the plausible similarity of

     McGee (TTBC) says that “whether Peter was referring to the pre–Adamic judgment or to the judgment in
Noah’s day is a matter of conjecture” and that he has “vacillated between these two viewpoints,” but he prefers the
latter as it is the majority opinion. In contrast, I have oscillated between the two and prefer the former despite the
majority opinion. “The world that then existed” at the time of creation in Gen 1:1-2 was formed out of a watery
chaos in Gen 1:1 (so 2Pet 3:5), to an orderly state so that the angels sang for joy (Job 38:7), and was returned
to a state of watery chaos in Gen 1:2 (so 2Pet 3:6), when many of the angels rebelled. Adopting the Noahic
position results in dual contradictions to which commentators who invoke it are blind. Adams (CCC), for example,
says: “The original watery chaos out of which the earth was formed is first mentioned. This happened through God’s
Word at the beginning. Then later, the flood occurred through the waters that fell on the earth and that were spewed
forth by the fountains of the deep.” No, contrary to Adams, Peter is not talking about the Noahic flood that came
later; rather, it came upon the world that then existed at that time, that is, at the time associated with the formation
of the world. As Wuest (WSGNT) well surmises regarding 2Pet 3:5-6: “This refers to the cataclysm of Genesis 1:2
where we read, ‘and the earth became without form and void, and darkness was upon the face of the deep.’ It was
the judgment upon the fall of the angel Lucifer and the consequent apostasy of the pre-Adamic race.”
Notwithstanding, some RETs go along with the popular opinion that 2Pet 3:5-6 refers to the Noahic flood (e.g.,
Alberino, Birthright, 169ff). On the positive side, this dissension in the RET ranks demonstrates that RET is not
dependent upon the Luciferian flood interpretation of 2Pet 3:5-6. Indeed, in his section, “Two Global Floods,” Dill
says, “The fact that the earth has been subjected to two global floods is a foundational component of the Gap
Theory” (emphasis his, 291). Yet he makes his case primarily from Gen 1:2 and Job 38:1-11, not mentioning 2Pet
3:5-6, noting that GAP associates Job 38:1-7 with the creation and 38:8-11 with the restoration. Thus, 2Pet 3:5-6
might be considered auxiliary to the RET position. For pro-RET arguments, McCrillis gives numerous points
(KL 3976-4888); Yates can also be consulted (GAP, 296-297). However, some RETs overstate their case. For
example, Dake says that since “they were ignorant of the flood of which he speaks,” it could not have been Noah’s
flood. Instead, it must have been a pre-Adamic flood that was “hidden from them” (Another, 67). This argument
backfires. The text says that they were willfully (theo) ignorant. I would amend his argument by saying that the
flood in 2Pet 3:5-6 is not Noah’s flood since they are capable of being willfully ignorant of the flood entailed.
They are not willfully ignorant of Noah’s flood. Rather, they know about it and deny it. Knowledge about
the Luciferian flood, on the other hand, is much more limited and easily ignored. Still, his discussion of the
contrasts between the Luciferian flood and the Noachian flood is worthy of consultation (pp. 76-78).

            The merkabah is a huge anomaly and largely passed over because of its interpretation as simply

      general word that means “vehicle”. In Jewish Mysticism and other teachings on the metaphysical, the
      merkabah is a vehicle that allows transport between our physical reality and the spiritual plane.
      Normally we would completely ignore mysticism and metaphysical teachings, but in this case there
      seems to be a little bit of truth to these beliefs. In the Bible we find the following in reference to the

        Merkabah Mysticism expands upon the biblical throne-chariot motif. Ancient Alien theories likewise find
fertile ground here. Ezekiel describes his vision as thus: “And as I looked, behold, a storm wind was coming from
the north, a great cloud with fire flashing forth continually and a bright light around it, and in its midst something
like glowing metal in the midst of the fire. And within it there were figures resembling four living beings. And this
was their appearance: they had human form” (Eze 1:4-5). Of course, it takes little imagination to picture a spaceship
with creatures inside. These flying creatures are cherubim (Eze 10:1-20). This spaceship is very expansive. Ezekiel
describes what he sees at the upper part of that expanse: “Now above the expanse that was over their heads there
was something resembling a throne, like lapis lazuli in appearance; and on that which resembled a throne, high up,
was a figure with the appearance of a man” (Eze 1:26). The spaceship has a throne room, a control room. Since the
Lord mounts cherubim to fly (Ps 18:10), one need not strain very hard to picture a large mothership from which
smaller spaceships can emerge. Regardless, such passages show that the Lord’s transport vehicles come in various
types and sizes. New Jerusalem is a transport vehicle (Rev 21:2). Prehistory will repeat itself at the conclusion of
our history. The Lord will use this warship to defeat Satan in this final battle as He did in a climatic battle eons ago.

Angelic Weapons
       Since entire books are devoted to the discussion of these weapons, summary statements will have to suffice
for present purposes.172 Childress begins his book devoted to this subject by explaining:

             The subject of ancient technology has always fascinated me and the subject of vimanas has
      always been an important part of this discussion, at least for me. Here was a topic that covered
      everything from lost cities, ancient flight, super-charged weapons and the struggle between good and

      the side of good, and some hot babes on top of all that. Seems like we have a good story here, in the
      tales of the mysterious Rama Empire and all of its rather wacky struggles for respect and female virtue,
      that seems more like a Flash Gordon movie than one of the most important religious sagas of all time.
      We call this story the Ramayana. The other fabulous ancient Indian epic is the Mahabharata, which is
      a series of 18 books, and includes aerial warfare and the use of flying machines known in Sanskrit
      as “vimanas.” For clarification, an abbreviated version of the Ramayana appears in the Mahabharata
      as part of its story-in-a-story writing style….
             ….Indeed, certain ancient kings were described as ruling the entire earth, and some as the
      “Rulers of Three Planets,” presumably meaning the three planets of Earth, Mars and another
      which is sometimes called Tiamat (from Sumerian texts) or Planet X. This is supposedly the
      missing planet between Mars and Jupiter that is now the asteroid belt—an exploded planet
      perhaps?173

Some of his dating proposals would be compatible with pre-Adamic epics:
      With the date of circa 7,200 BC for artifacts from the supposed sunken city of Dwaraka, we may have
      another possible date for the vimanas and weapons of the Kurukshetra War—an astonishing
      9,000 or 10,000 years ago! (KL 404).

      Some scholars would say that the events of the Ramayana are entirely fictional and never happened at
      all; others would say that the story unfolded around 600 BC, but I maintain that that would be when
      the tale was recorded in Brahmi script. Since the events predate those of the Mahabharata, which as
      we have seen must have taken place before 3000 BC, the Ramayana reaches great antiquity. It may
      have happened as far back as 11,000 BC, during the Treta Yuga, thought to have ended circa 9500
      BC. (KL 909).

       His various discussions of how spinning mercury was a key part of the technology give considerable
plausibility to the fundamental factuality of some of the tales. Some of these vimanas were quite large: “By using
the prescribed processes one can build a vimana as large as the temple of the God-in-motion” (KL 2690). And it
may explain the technology behind flying saucers (KL 2793-2870). However, such stories are embellished and told
through a polytheistic lens with mythical embellishments. Childress seems to be taken in by the literary spin:
             Considering the fascinating photos of pyramids and other structures found on Mars by NASA,
      we may believe Mars to have been a planet worthy of “bringing under control.” Perhaps Venus
      (sometimes referred to as Hesperus) is the third planet. Even more interestingly, perhaps this third
      planet is a planet that supposedly once existed between Mars and Jupiter, where the asteroid belt exists
      today. The populace of this planet allegedly blew it up many thousands of years ago, while playing
      around with some very dangerous and destructive technology—a lesson that the people of our
      planet at this point in time and space might well learn before we repeat such a cosmic disaster. (KL
      602-615).

       Fallen angels created pre-Adamic hybrids, according to some RETs. So, this claim of extraterrestrial hybrids
could have a kernel of truth. Then again, some RETs pose that God created aliens throughout the universe, so
interaction with extraterrestrials from “a planet in the Sirus system” (KL 2207) might be deemed plausible. Artifacts

since the carbon dating placed them back almost 10,000 years ago. “At first it had been thought that the caves had
been the home of an unknown species of ape. But as the species seemed to bury its dead they eliminated an ape
race” (KL 2243). “While we might conclude that much of the story of the Dropa and its disks is a hoax, the mystery
of bi disks and jade congs is quite real” (KL 2387). The proposition that the Lake of Gems was “attended by both
male and female Immortals” (KL 2991) is consistent with my belief in male and female angels.
       Vimanas and the Wars of the Gods, by Baccarini, has an introduction by Graham Hancock, concerning whom
I gave some interaction in MMP2. In my opinion, Hancock conflates advanced pre-Adamic and post-Adamic
civilizations and their corresponding destructions. Hancock is open to the possibility of human interaction with
aliens but sees no need to postulate such interaction, being content with positing very advanced human civilizations
in the past. From a RET perspective, I would reject his disinclination to acknowledge ancient alien interaction.174
As Baccarini notes, the typical Western view advocated by Christianity would put the Noachian flood about 4,500
years ago and creation at 6,000 years ago. Therefore, posing “The Big Flood” 12,000-10,000 years ago presents a
considerable timing problem (KL 731, 997). RET offers a solution. Pose two separate floods, one Luciferian and
one Noachian, with separate civilizations associated with each flood. From the biblical perspective of RET, both
floods would be associated with the war of the gods. Reading this type of secular material through a biblical lens
yields both compatibilities and incompatibilities. One compatibility would be Baccarini’s definition: “The term
Vimana derives from the Sanskrit and it means a mythological flying object often identified as ‘God’s car’ used by
the divinities to move into the sky and to fight their battles” (KL 1668). These divinities were engaged in aerial
combat, which is what would be expected biblically. Both fallen angels and unfallen angels used flying cars—
divine chariots. Surely, the “chariots of fire” that Elisha saw were not earthbound (2Kgs 6:17). He had seen one of
them take Elisha into the heavens (2Kgs 2:11). These angelic areal crafts were designed for battle according to the
biblical context.
       Vedic statements about some vimanas being used by divine beings and some by human beings are not
surprising (KL 1799). Even today, black ops are reputed to have backward engineered alien technology to produce
their own UFOs. Not surprisingly, the divine aliens kept the more powerful weapons for themselves:

            The Astra (Astras at the plural), the category of the divine weaponry with some characteristics
      completely different from those used by humans, usually invoked through a mantra or through sacred
      hymns. In the Hinduism the Astra is supernatural weapons, because of their nature, they are different
      and they totally differ from the traditional weapons. (KL 3343)

       Likewise, the technology that fallen angels share with humanity is far lesser than their more advanced angelic
technology. We might be able to produce a little UFO, but producing a mile-long mothership could be well beyond
our capabilities, much less producing a heavenly city. Picturing New Jerusalem as a mothership in a geostationary
orbit above Earth and from which smaller flying craft emerged is not far removed from some of the Vedic texts:

      His incredible wisdom made him to build three flying towns known together with the name of Tripura,
      made with gold, silver and iron…they could not only to move in the sky, but also to entertain in what
      today we could define as an geostationary orbit around the Earth and also they were owed some ‘doors’
      able to make to enter some ‘small flying carts.’ (KL 2391)

When God destroys our universe by fire at the end of time (2Pet 3:7), how will He do it? Might He fire a blast from

raises some interesting questions. Can one god kill another god? Can one angel kill another angel? Can angels use
angelic technology to kill other angels? Can mortals use fallen angel technology to kill unfallen angels? In Scripture,
the battles are real, so one would suppose real casualties. Some of these weapons are reputed to be charged with all
the power of the Universe. Might fallen angels think that they could destroy New Jerusalem with such weapons? If
so, they have seriously underestimated the power of the One who sits on the throne of New Jerusalem. In any case,
since this war will affect the whole universe, it makes sense that the whole universe might be involved in it. The
size of such a force staggers the imagination. According to Vada texts, “some beings belonging to higher planets,
invisible to the man” (KL 4152). “There are many astral spheres filled with such beings. Their inhabitants use some
astral vehicles or masses of light to travel from one planet to another faster than the electricity and the radioactive
energies” (KL 4222). The universe could be teeming with life, both celestial and extraterrestrial, if such accounts
are to be believed:

      According to the most ancient Hindu wisdom different types of beings are living in the cosmos, some

             Reading the Vedas, whose first ‘written’ draft is officially dated about 2,000 BC, we find many

      inhabited by different varieties of populations.” (KL 4134)

             It may sound absurd or unbelievable, but in our mind the verses of the Padma Purana are
      echoing, the text known since at least 500 BC, which states that in the cosmos there are 8,400,000
      forms of life, 900,000 of which are aquatic, 2,000,000 are consisting of trees and plants; 1.1 million

       RET would allow the possibility, even the probability in my opinion, of other sentient beings in the universe.

forces of good and evil. Presently, some have speculated that these wars can be observed far out in space. This

Knowledge of Good and Evil
     Langford seems to postulate that Adam gained knowledge of this conflict between good and evil (which
would presumably include the destruction of Planet Rahab) when he ate the forbidden fruit:

             In addition we must also remember that planted right in the middle of the Garden of Eden was
      the tree “of the knowledge of good and evil.” That means, of course, that the principles of “good and
      evil” were already in existence BEFORE ADAM SINNED! For Adam and Eve to partake of that
      forbidden fruit would open their consciousness to the whole realm of conflict between “goodness
      and sinfulness.” Adam’s sin did not create original evil! Neither did Adam’s sin create original death!
      Evil in principle already existed. Obviously, evil, as a principle in the universe already existed in
      Lucifer! And indeed, death already existed as represented by the separation of Lucifer from God, and
      this no doubt involved a great deal more. Just remember, the whole conflict between good and evil
      already existed in the universe, and right there in the midst of that garden was the fruit that would
      unlock the experimental realization of evil and death for Adam and all his posterity.
             However, at the time of Adam’s creation he was not aware of that conflict. To partake of the
      forbidden fruit, in rebellion to God’s command, would awaken in Adam’s inner soul the
      knowledge of this conflict, in both the intellectual knowledge about it, but also in the experimental
      realization of it.175

       This postulation of cognitive downloads reminds me of episodes in science fiction movies, such as the Matrix,
where knowledge of how to perform martial arts or fly a helicopter could be downloaded into an individual’s
consciousness via an interface. As a result of their partaking of this fruit, God says, “Behold, the man has become
like one of Us, knowing good and evil” (Gen 3:22). The Lord could not have been referring to an experiential
knowledge of good and evil because God includes Himself and is making this affirmation in reference to Himself
and the divine council of unfallen holy angels. While it is true that Adam’s knowledge included an experiential
realization, God’s reference must be focused exclusively on intellectual knowledge. Moses says, “Then the eyes of
both of them were opened, and they knew that they were naked” (Gen 3:7).176 This Semitic expression can refer to

                                                     Conclusion
       The migratory nature of Heavenly City has been demonstrated to be both interdimensional and interplanetary
from prehistoric times until the beginning of the eternal state. Subsequent discussions herein will even suggest a
probable expansion of its range of access during the eternal state. For the present chapter, however, it suffices to
conclude that New Jerusalem is a spaceship that functions as a warship in times of war. It has cloaking capabilities
and is protected by a force field, making it impervious to external attack, even from scalar weapons purported to be
charged with zero-point energy and capable of destroying the universe. The probable scenario is that God exploded
Planet Rahab by a scalar blast from this Heavenly Chariot, causing the Luciferian flood. Subsequently, the City
relocated to above Earth at the time of Earth’s restoration and remained there until the time of Noah’s flood.
Residents of Earth were able to see this Satellite City during that timeframe. Some OT saints aspired to live in the

      arrayed (Mark 9:2–3). The moment they sinned, Adam and Eve saw the light go out. The death of the
      spirit within them caused the light to be extinguished and, suddenly, the physical side of their being
      was thrust into a prominence it had never had before. They knew they were naked.

More speculative arguments might pose that the Adam and Eve of Gen 2 were originally animated by spirit rather
than by blood. Thus, they would not have been able to procreate in that state. The command to procreate was given
to the Day-6 humans rather than to Adam and Eve. Not until after Adam and Eve fell and became animated by
blood would they have been able to reproduce.
