Humans are the only species that can receive eternal life—regenerate life. The NAS says that we were originally
created “a little lower than God” (Ps 8:5). The Hebrew term for God here is the plural term elohim. In this context,
the reference is not to Creator God but to created gods and goddesses. Thus, the LXX and various translations
render it as “a little lower than the angels.” Unbelievers have the unrealized capacity to partake of God’s nature
and thus are not ontologically superior to angels. Believers receive God’s nature as a gift by simply believing in
Jesus for eternal life as a gift. Once they have done so, they have the potential to develop this inward life into its
full capacity by the power of the Holy Spirit so that they can qualify to be the Bride of Christ. Unfaithful believers
have the unrealized capacity to partake of God’s nature more fully by developing a misthologically mature spirit.
Faithful believers will fully realize this capacity, become the Bride of Christ, share His throne, and ontologically be
far superior to the angels. Not all humans will be superior to the angels.

infinite 3D Space Cities scattered through all regions of space. This proposal, in turn, necessitated the postulation

is that the 3D Space Cities are 3D Teleportal Cities that have immediate teleportal access to the 4D Celestial City.
The latter serves as the hub for all the former.
                                           Illustration 96. 4D-City Hub




       To enter the 3D Cities would be to enter the 4D Hub City. Or at least entrance into the 3D Cities would allow
entrance into the 4D City if one proceeded far enough into the 3D City. In either case, each 3D City allows direct
access to the 4D City. But how can this one 4D City provide an infinite number of accesses to an unlimited number
of human elohim? And where will an increasingly infinite number of human elohim live? Two proposals might be
made to allow both infinite residence and infinite access.
       One conjecture is that human elohim might have residences on the outside of the walls of the 3D Cities or
inside the walls of the 3D Cities. We all know the story of Rahab in Josh 2:15: “Her house was built into the city
wall, so that she lived in the wall” (ESV). Other translations say, “Her house was on the city wall, so that she was
living on the wall.” Likewise, the millennial temple on Earth foreshadows Heavenly City as having chambers in its
Misthological Models Part 5                                                                               Page 276
thick walls (Eze 42:10). The human elohim of each respective 3D City above the respective earth they are ruling
might have residences on/in the walls of their respective 3D City from which they can (1) see their planet outside
the 3D City and (2) see the 4D City inside the 3D City, or at least have immediate access to the 4D City if they
walked through the door/portal leading to the inside. If so, the bridal elohim have additional 4D residences inside
their 3D City, thus inside the 4D City. Whether non-bridal elohim have additional residences inside the 4D City
would be a matter of speculation and require infinite space inside the 4D City. They will forever be second-class
visitors to the 4D City, not its first-class residents.
                                    Illustration 97. 4D Universe and 4D City




        The second conjecture as to how an infinite number of human elohim might have an infinite number of
residences is that the 4D City might have infinite internal space and be able to accommodate infinite residences
within it. Presumably, though, the 4D City could not contain infinite 4D space. The possibility of infinite internal
space would seem to be limited to 3D space. Therefore, this second proposition is difficult to accept as plausible.
How could a 4D building with finite dimensions accommodate an infinitely growing number of 4D beings? At
present, I do not foresee this as being possible.
        Admittedly, these two propositions are not necessarily mutually exclusive. Both could be true. As stated in
the first proposition, human elohim might have residences on the outside of the walls of the 3D Cities or inside the
walls of the 3D Cities, and, as posed in this second proposition, they might have (additional) residences inside the
4D City. Nevertheless, the basic problem still remains. How can a finite City, even if it is in four dimensions,
accommodate an infinitely growing number of infinite residences in the same dimension? It does not seem plausible.
        Along with some others, I believe the internal space in the 4D City to be infinite. Like myself, some have
postulated that you can have universes inside the 4D City. However, I would further postulate that these internal
universes are 3D. In my assessment, the multiverse is a 4D Universe filled with finite 4D hyperspace, containing a
limitless number of 3D universes. Likewise, the 4D City houses an unlimited number of 3D universes. Both the
4D Universe and the 4D City can accommodate unlimited 3D spaces. Additionally, this 4D Universe is probably
capable of an infinite increase in its 4D capacity of internal 4D hyperspace, thus accommodating an infinite growth
in the number of its 4D residences as the number of 4D human elohim increases throughout eternity. But the same
does not appear to be true of the 4D City. It does not expand externally. Therefore, the 4D City contains a limited
amount of 4D hyperspace.
Chapter 7. New Jerusalem as the Bride                                                                       Page 277
       The above illustration is not drawn to scale and is merely an aid for conceptual representation. The
4D Universe is pictured as expandable with the four arrows. The 4D City, on the other hand, is probably finite
regarding its 4D dimensionality and thus not capable of 4D expansion. Hence, no expansion arrows are pictured
with the City. Nevertheless, it can contain an unlimited number of 3D universes because the 3D universes would
not take up 4D hyperspace, only be assessable from the 4D hyperspace, as explained below regarding 3D cross-
sections of 4D hyperspace.359 Additionally, the 3D universes inside the 4D City could be externally quite small. For
instance, the external size of some of these 3D universes in 4D space could be the size of a 3D bowling ball, others
the size of a 3D marble. Overcomers might keep an assortment of these 3D universes in their 4D rooms, if they like,
and vary their external size as desired.
       Nonetheless, a 4D being cannot be confined to 3D space. Thus, only a finite number of 4D beings could live
in these 3D universes. You cannot have an infinite number of 4D second-tier elohim occupying either the 4D City
or even the unlimited number of 3D universes inside the 4D City. The problem remains of theorizing how the
4D City could accommodate residences for an unlimited number of second-tier human elohim. Since I do not
presently see how this would be possible, I must rule out the second option, at least from my limited understanding
of 4D hyperspace. Accordingly, the best hypothesis I can presently venture is that second-tier elohim will not have
residences inside the 4D City. The Bridal City will be the residence for bridal overcomers, that is, for the finite
number of first-tier human elohim. It will not be a residence for the infinite number of second-tier elohim. To be
sure, second-tier elohim will be able to access the 4D City and perhaps even rent rooms there like we would rent
hotel rooms for temporary stays. But they will not be able to reside there.
       At this point, if not before, the inquiry seemingly reduces to a question of absurdity, like the question, “How
many angels can dance on the head of a pin?” a question that supposedly has no practical value. Some of those
trying to pose an actual number tend to suggest three possible answers: (1) none, or (2) an infinite amount because
like ether or gas (or should we say air or flame, Heb 1:7?) they could surround the pin. Alternatively, (3) a quantum
number, computed from quantum physics, that to the human mind would be practically infinite, is posed:
8.6766*10^49.
       In any case, Lk 8:30 seems to be applicable: “And Jesus asked him, ‘What is your name?’ And he said,
‘Legion’; for many demons had entered him.” A legion would literally be 6,000. Apparently, a theoretically infinite
number of demons (i.e., 4D beings) could enter the man (i.e., a 3D being), that is, intersect and interact with the
man, but none of them were fully contained by him. They were inside of him in the sense of intersecting with him,
but none of them were fully contained within him since a 4D space cannot be fully contained by a 3D space.
       Let us reason by means of analogy and consider the question, “How many 3D cubes can fit inside a 2D
square?” The answer is none. But how many 3D cubes can intersect a 2D square? The answer would be a quantum
number involving factoring in Plank lengths. Yet we do not know that Plank-length limitations exist in 4D space.
Furthermore, even if you reduce the size of the square to one-Plank-length-by-one-Plank-length and compute the
number of access points by Plank-length cubes, you easily get at least five.

       We do not really know how quantum computing actually works, but we do know that it works extremely

and be packed into it like a can of sardines. Nevertheless, they can have unlimited commercial access to it. Think
of the cubical City as being the black box of a quantum computer that allows faster than light computations from
higher dimensions. Regardless of our limited understanding of how the commercial access to the City will actually
work, the universal access to the Space City pictured in Rev 21:3 gives us reason to believe that the City will be
able to accommodate universal commercial needs. Notwithstanding, the biblical imagery does not give us reason
to believe that everyone will live inside the City. Quite the opposite.
       Intuitively and mathematically, we must deduce that the Bridal City is the habitation of the original bridal
overcomers, not the habitation of secondary human elohim. The finite 4D City cannot be the home of an infinite
number of secondary elohim. Even so, I would pose that the 4D City can accommodate infinite access for contact
and commerce purposes with these secondary human elohim. For example, the 4D City would be able to host an
unlimited number of teleportal interfaces and virtual meeting spaces. Therefore, postulating that it remains the
business hub of transdimensional commerce, as pictured in Rev 21:24-26, remains reasonable. As a corollary, I
would hypothesize that second-tier elohim are not worshipped. Worship is probably limited to the uppermost Elohim
and first-tier elohim. The former (God Almighty) will certainly cause some immortals to worship the latter (that is,
bridal saints). See IMOC and Rev 3:9. Whether smortals or even smortals who become immortals will be required
to worship the original bridal Gods and Goddesses, I cannot say with certitude. Pay homage, definitely. Pay
monetary tribute, most reasonably. Pay honor to the point of being required to kneel before them in worship,
possibly.

       Spherical Exterior of the 3D City
       This Space City is measurable, therefore, finite in its housing capability. As discussed above, regarding its
twelve gates facing in all four Terran directions, Terrans from all of space, thus from the entire multiverse, will be
able to access it universally. On the other hand, access is limited in some capacities, as indicated by the limited
number of its gates above and its finite dimensions here. As to its shape, McGee believes New Jerusalem will be a
cube inside a sphere with the corners of the cube touching the sphere, so New Jerusalem is actually a spherical cube.
Chapter 7. New Jerusalem as the Bride                                                                     Page 279

             Now consider with me the shape of the city. “The city lieth foursquare” is the simple declaration
      of Scripture. That would seem to indicate that the city is a cube with fifteen hundred miles on a side.
      Dr. Seiss sees it as a cube. Dr. Harry Ironside sees it as a pyramid. Still, others interpret these
      measurements in as many geometric figures as can be conceived. However, it is difficult for us
      to conceive of either a cube or a pyramid projected out in space. We are accustomed to thinking
      of a sphere (that is a ball-shaped object) hanging in space, because that is the general shape of
      the heavenly bodies. As far as we know, there are none out there that are square like a cube or
      like a pyramid. Cubes and pyramids are appropriate for earth’s buildings, but they are as
      impractical for space as spheres are impractical for earthly buildings. Yet it is definitely stated
      that the city is foursquare.
             The difficulty resolves when we think of the city as a cube within a crystal–clear sphere.
      What we are given are the inside measurements. I think of it as a big plastic ball with a cube
      inside, having all eight of its corners touching the sphere. As this involves mathematics, which I
      could not figure out, I asked both a mathematician and an engineer involved in the space program to
      determine what the circumference of the sphere would be. They both came up with the same answer.
      To enclose a cube measuring 1,500 miles on each side, the circumference of the sphere would be about
      8,164 miles. The diameter of the moon is about 2,160 miles, and that of the New Jerusalem sphere is
      about 2,600 miles. Thus, the New Jerusalem will be somewhat larger than the moon, and it will be a
      sphere like the other heavenly bodies. I personally believe that this is the picture that is given to us
      here. (TTBC; italics his.)
                                  Illustration 99. Cubical City Within a Sphere
Misthological Models Part 5                                                                                   Page 280
       McGee then includes a picture, which I have adapted into Illustration 99. Cubical City Within a Sphere. His
proposal is interesting. Moreover, it has some scientific basis. Large objects in space are spherical because of
gravity. Objects over 1000 kilometers (620 miles) in diameter tend to be spherical because of their inner gravitation
pull, and the diameter of the City far exceeds that spherical threshold. Perhaps the outer sphere has a counter gravity
field that pulls outward, thus offsetting, to some degree, the inward gravitational pull of the internal City. This
possibility is suggested by what McGee goes on to suggest after presenting his picture:

             My thinking is that we will live inside this sphere, not on the outside. Here on earth, we live on
      the outside, and that presents a few difficulties. The Lord had to make the law of gravity to hold us on
      the earth, or we would be flying out into space. We walk on the outside here, but I think that we will
      walk on the inside of the New Jerusalem. (TTBC; emphasis his.)

       If we can walk on the inside of the sphere, then it must have gravity pulling outside, away from the City.
Even so, for various reasons of my own, completely aside from gravitational speculations, since the City is
transdimensional and quite possibly not subject to such gravitational limitations, I concur that New Jerusalem will
be within a sphere. Even if the outer sphere is not needed for offsetting gravity, it might be needed to allow the City
to travel at speeds in excess of the speed of light. After all, the City is a spaceship. In any case, the sphere would be
needed for various other purposes: (1) as a biosphere (allowing the Tree of Life to live on the outside the City and
the Water of Life to flow down its walls, etc.), (2) as a time bubble (time displacement sphere), and (3) as a force
field (protecting the City).
       Regardless, I believe the internal 3D City will be in the shape of a pyramidal mountain, thus a ziggurat, not
a cube. However, I believe the 4D City will be a cube. Nevertheless, eyewitness accounts, as documented in MMP4,
confirm that the 4D City will be inside a sphere, but the sphere will be much larger than the 4D City, enclosing all
of Planet Paradise. My conjecture is that the sphere of the 3D City will be a little larger than the 3D City itself,
though that is a matter of pure speculation. Even so, for the sake of comparison with McGee’s picture, I will reduce
the size of the sphere to match the points of the Pyramidal City as McGee did for his illustration.
                                    Illustration 100. Spherical Pyramid or Cube




       The Spherical Pyramid (SP) is, of course, smaller than the Spherical Cube 1 (SC1). They are drawn to scale
relative to each other’s interior dimensions, representing a city that is 1500 miles square at the base and having a
height of 1500 miles. Spherical Cube 2 (SC2) has been rotated to the orientation provided by McGee for better
visualization of the points of the City touching the sphere. Both the SC1 and SC2 are the same size. Although I
prefer the SP model, which is the smaller model, ample space is still available in the Pyramidal City, as shown by
my computations.

      Pyramidal Computations
      Computations pertaining to the City’s pyramidal size were provided in MMP1. To briefly summarize part of
Chapter 7. New Jerusalem as the Bride                                                                         Page 281
that discussion, Dillow imagined that a “hundred million faithful believers” seated at “ten million tables” would
pose a spatial problem for a literal interpretation. In computing the seating space required, I used an internet site for
such computations: http://www.banquettables.pro/space-and-capacity-calculator. This site is designed specifically
for the purpose of computing how much seating is required for a banquet. The space needed to serve 100,000,000
faithful believers for rectangular tables served was: 1,000,000,000 square feet. (It was calculating 10 sq. ft. per
person.) That would only take a 6x6 mile area! So that we can leave a 1x1 mile area in the center of the Banquet
Hall for a raised platform and large stadium screen, let us suppose a 7x7 mile dimension. To maintain a stadium
perspective, suppose it has a height of 4 miles. A stadium that is only 7x7x4 would be super tiny in a city of
1500x1500x1500! Yet this is all the space we would need to accommodate what Dillow thought was an impossible
figure.
                               Illustration 101. Truncated Square Pyramids of China




       Since I pose that the Bema stadium is at the top of the City, postulating some calculation for the square
footage at the top of the City will be necessary. If the Great Pyramids of China hint at the actual dimensions of the
truncation, then postulating a truncation of 400 x 400 seems like a reasonable estimation. The pyramid pictured on
the right in Illustration 101. Truncated Square Pyramid is the one Krieger labels as the New Jerusalem of China.360
The picture on the right is another one of China’s great pyramids. The proportion of the square footage of the flat
top to the rest of the pyramid appears to be roughly the same in both pictures. The truncation in both pyramids
seems to be a little less than 1/3 of the width of the pyramid. A third of 1500 would be 500. So I am being very
conservative and using a low number by rounding down to 400.

accommodate over 446 billion people! There is plenty of room!
       As noted, my calculations assume that the City is in the shape of a truncated square pyramid because, along
with many others, I believe that its description as a mountain makes this pyramidal shape the preferred model. Many
others, however, prefer the cubical model, in which case the City would have much more room than what I have
calculated. Krieger insists that the pyramidal and cubical models should be combined: “Reconciling the
‘Mountain of the Lord” object with the cubed New Jerusalem, one can only conclude that ‘somehow’ it is
BOTH, i.e., ‘multi-dimensional.’”361 My proposal provides a how for Krieger’s somehow. The 4D version of the
City is cubical, while the 3D version is pyramidal.

       Dimensional Cross Sections
       Just as a 3D object projects a 2D shadow, a 4D object projects a 3D shadow. The Bible seems to suggest that
the Heavenly City has four spatial dimensions when it explicitly says that the items associated with earthly worship,
and the tabernacle in particular, “serve as copy and shadow of the heavenly things” (Heb 8:5) and that the “holy
place” was “a copy of the true one,” that is, the heavenly one, (Heb 9:24), namely the Heavenly City (Heb 11:10,16;
12:22), which was prepared for those misthologically seeking the City (Heb 11:14; 13:14). These things, and the
tabernacle, in particular, are copies and shadows of something that is real. Given that WH is emphasizing this
relationship and saying that the 3D tabernacle is a copy and shadow of the Heavenly City, one might think
that he is hinting at its 4D dimensionality. Shadow in this context means to be “bound to and dependent on
the solid body which casts it,” and copy means “the earthly copy of the heavenly realities, or possibly a sketch
of them, as in Ezk 42:15.”362
       The above material is an abbreviated extract from MMP1 that provides a computational and 3D-4D review.
The advanced consideration being added here in MMP5 is to propose that the 4D City can have more than one
3D shadow/copy. As we know, a 3D object can have multiple shadows if it has multiple light sources. Plus, it can
easily be copied many times. Thus, the biblical imagery suggests that the 3D City can be replicated/copied.
                                  Illustration 103. 2D Cross-Section of a 3D Cube




361
      Krieger, Signs, 50-51.
362
      Paul Ellingworth, Hebrews, NIGTC, s.v., 8:5.
Chapter 7. New Jerusalem as the Bride                                                                     Page 283
       Additionally, as is well known, you can pass a 3D cube through a 2D plane to get a 2D square cross-section,
as shown on the cubes on the left. Consequently, if you were to pass a 3D cube through an infinite number of planes,
you could produce an infinite number of squares. Alternatively, if you were to change the origination of the plane,
you could produce other cross-sectioned shapes, such as a triangle, as pictured on the cubes on the right in
Illustration 104. In a similar manner, you could produce an infinite number of triangles.
                                        Illustration 104. 4D City Tesseract




       The objection might be raised that a 4D cube is a tesseract, which unfolds into eight 3D cubes in 3D space,
which is finite in the amount of 3D space it can accommodate. In response, let it be noted that the eight 3D cubes
simply compute the hypersurface area of a tesseract, not its volume. As to the computation of volume, consider how
many 2D spaces will fit into a 3D cube. The answer is an infinite number unless the 2D areas are measured in a
manner relative to the volume of the 3D cube. Area (which is 2D) does not take up volume (which is 3D) unless the
area is extended into the third dimension. For example, mathematically, you can take an infinite number of square
cross-sections of a 3D cube to produce an infinite number of 2D squares. You can measure the area of the 2D
squares and still have an infinite number of squares in that 3D space that could be accessed from that 3D space.
You can even change the 2D size of the area if you wish by taking a smaller cross-section. Only when you measure
the squares relative to the third dimension do they become finite. When measured in that third dimension, they
would at least have to be a Plank length in width. They cannot be infinitely small. Yet we do not know that the 4D
spectrum has a minimum corresponding width. Perhaps you can go infinitely small in 4D. Regardless, the size of
the 3D spaces within the 4D cube would not take up any 4D space if the 3D spaces are not extended in the fourth
dimension. The 3D Pyramidal Cities would be contained within the 4D Universe and be assessable within it but not
take up space in the fourth dimension. Therefore, you could have an infinite number of 3D cities, 3D planets, and
3D universes in the 4D Universe pictured earlier in Illustration 97. 4D Universe and 4D City (p. 276). As a visual
reminder of the 4D nature of the 4D City, the 4D City has been represented as a tesseract in Illustration 104 with
3D universes inside.
Misthological Models Part 5                                                                                 Page 284
                                      Illustration 105. 3D/4D View of 2D/3D




        What would a spherical 3D universe look like to 4D Gods or Goddesses living in the 4D City? These 4D
Gods or Goddesses would be able to see the entire 3D universe. To illustrate, consider the 2D flatlanders Joe and
Mary in the left part of the illustration who live in a rectangle in 2D flatland and are separated by a wall. In the
illustration, would Joe be able to see Mary? No. For that matter, even if the wall were removed, Joe would only be
able to see Mary’s outer realm. He would not be able to see that she is pink inside. Likewise, Mary would not be
able to see that Joe is blue inside. On the other hand, Mike is a 3D being who can see both Joe and Mary since he
is outside their realm, though they are assessable to his realm. The wall is no hindrance to Mike seeing them both.
Plus, Mike can see inside Joe and Mary since he can see them in their entirety.
        In a similar fashion, 4D elohim can apparently see the entirety of any 3D object in their realm. People having
near-death experiences report being able to see the people in their hospital rooms plus what is going on in other
rooms. Judging from the extrapolation in the above illustration, if they had more time to learn how to use their new
ability, they would presumably not only be able to see those people and the Earth but also inside those people and
the Earth. As an aside, a reasonable deduction is that angels can look at people and see their internal spirit and
immediately tell if someone is regenerate or not. Plus, angels (both fallen and unfallen) can probably get a good
idea of the spiritual health or depth of depravity of a person with just a glance at his or her spirit.
                                 Illustration 106. 3D Cross-Section of a 3D Cube




       Proceeding now with our cross-section analogy, if you were to use a 3D plane to take a 3D cross-section of
a 3D cube using that same orientation that was used to produce a triangle, you would get a 3D truncated three-sided
pyramid. After all, a 3D plane would have a top and a bottom, thus producing a truncated pyramid as its cross-
section. In like fashion, if you were to create a cross-section of a 4D cube using a 3D plane, you evidently would
be able to produce an infinite number of 3D truncated pyramids. In an analogous manner, I propose that an infinite
Chapter 7. New Jerusalem as the Bride                                                                        Page 285
number of 3D truncated pyramidal Heavenly Cities can be used in 3D space to access the singular 4D cubical
Heavenly City. Since they are 3D pyramids, they would take up no space in the fourth dimension and could thus be
infinite in number.
                                   Illustration 107. Outside and Inside a Tardis




        If it is objected that the cross-section of the 3D cubed pictured is that of a three-sided pyramid, I would
suggest that a cross-section of a 4D cube might accordingly render a four-sided pyramid. Also, these cross-sectioned
illustrations are intended to be taken analogously. I am more inclined to think that the real situation is something
more akin to a TARDIS in the TV show Doctor Who. This spacecraft can take any desired shape on the outside but
has much more space on the inside. It can look like a telephone booth on the outside, for example, but if you open
the door, you will see a spaceship that is much larger than the outside. In the above illustration, part of the control
room of the spaceship has been shown to help aid the imagination. In effect, I am not only posing that the Heavenly
Space City is a spaceship that accesses more internal space than is perceived on the outside, but that this Space City
can be replicated to produce many such spaceships that access the same internal space. In terms of the illustration,
replicates of the original phonebooth could be created to access the interior of the singular spaceship.

       4D Hyperspace
       One problem with speaking definitively is that we can only speak speculatively as to how multidimensionality
and hyperspace really work. A further abbreviated excerpt from MMP1 may be helpful in that regard. Paul
seemingly wants believers to perceive the multidimensional “[1] breadth, and [2] length, and [3] depth, and
[4] height” of God’s love (Eph 3:18; KJV; MT). Many have anticipated that Paul is alluding to a 4D reality here.
The MT gives what appears to be the three earthly dimensions we normally perceive followed by a fourth spatial
dimension, which adds a heavenly dimension, referred to as height (hypsos—spelled with a psi that is transliterated
as ps). In his discussion of the 4D nature of this verse, Josh Peck thought that hypsos might be a rather direct
reference to hyperspace, speculating that hypsos served as the prefix hyper used in hyperspace because of the
similarity in spelling.363 Technically, he was mistaken in making this association in this manner. Our English prefix
hyper is actually derived from the Greek preposition hyper, not from hypos. In Greek, hyper is spelled with a pi
(which is transliterated with a p). This Greek hyper is a prefix that can serve as the first part of a compound word.
As a marker of spatiality, hyper means above. Therefore, the word that Paul actually uses in Eph 3:18 (i.e., hypsos)
does not mean hyperspace, at least not for the reason Peck originally hypothesized, for the simple reason that hyper
is the Greek word rendered as hyper in English, not hypsos. One would be premature, however, to dismiss Peck’s
argument due to his simple error regarding the word involved.

363
     Josh and Christina Peck, “Into the Multiverse 002: The Fourth Dimensions.” Available at
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P2yiS7C2bfk&list=PLJoaVZ5hNlnUsutIlyocH8pKfpskORhNu&index=7.
Accessed 1/13/2016.
Misthological Models Part 5                                                                                    Page 286
        For one thing, conceptually, one could argue that Paul is referring to hyperspace even though he does not use
the Greek form of hyper in Eph 3:18. According to BDAG, hypsos (1) as a dimension means height (Eph 3:18;
Rev 21:16), (2) as a place it means a high place (normally Heaven, Ps 17:17; 67:19; 101:20; Lk 1:78; 24:49;
Eph 4:8), and (3) as a status it means high position (Job 5:11; Jam 1:9). I would enjoin the usage in Eph 3:18 and
4:8 so as to conclude that Paul is talking about a heavenly place, that is, a heavenly dimension. Paul describes this
heavenly dimension as the fourth dimension in Eph 3:18. Conceptually, Peck’s overall argument is valid even
though his speculation regarding a direct association with the Greek word hyper was in error. This heavenly
dimension might be described as hyperspace, even without a direct association with the actual word hyper. Upon
initial examination, I thought that Peck’s argument would have to be left as being affirmed true at the conceptual
level, not at the linguistic level. However, Peck’s comment had piqued my interest as to whether the Greek word
hyper might ever be used in the Greek NT to describe hyperspace.
        As I looked through the compound Greek words composed with hyper as a prefix (hyper-this and hyper-
that), one word stood out as a very strong candidate—hyperano). According to BDAG, as a place, hyperano means
high above. I then observed that hyperano is equated with hypsos in Eph 4:8-10! “He ascended on
high...He...ascended high above all the heavens” (TM). In this context, as a place, hyperano means a space above
all the heavens. This place is space. One might assume that it is outer space. But actually, the Greek text uses a
compound form of hyper to describe this space, not a Greek word for outer. This space is not outer space, per se,
as we know it, but hyperspace, according to Paul. Specifically, according to Paul, this hyper-place is the highest
level of hyperspace! Because the place to which Christ ascended is the highest level of hyperspace, we should
deduce that He had to travel through hyperspace in order to reach this highest level of hyperspace. Spatially, one
should interpret this to mean that Christ ascended into hyperspace above all the heavens. Or, verbally, since
hyperano is an adverb, one might literally translate Paul as saying that Christ “hyperspaced above all the heavens”
(Eph 4:10; TM). This word study thus confirms my newer models of Heaven, which picture Heaven as the outer
realm of the multiverse, reachable through the hyperspace of the multiverse. Peck’s argument was conceptually
valid but linguistically flawed. Nevertheless, his linguistic error turned out to be minor in that he simply erred in
making a direct association with hyper rather than perceiving the indirect association. By combining the hypsos of
v. 8 with hyper of v. 10, which is contextually necessary, Peck’s linguistic argument is validated. Putting the pieces
together, in Eph 4:8-10, Paul is saying that Christ hyperspaced through hyperspace to reach the highest level of
hyperspace.
        Paul also said, “Eye has not seen and ear has not heard...all that God has prepared for those who love Him.”
(1Cor 2:9). Might these comments have been inspired in part by Paul’s visit to the 4D City in the 3rd Heaven
(1Cor 12:2-4)? This is one of the five interpretations discussed by BNTC:

                 The dimensions of the heavenly Jerusalem. A spiritualized topography of the Jerusalem Temple
         may lie behind the symbols of the dividing wall (2:14) and the cornerstone and foundations (2:20). So,
         ‘founded on love’ in the previous verse may evoke the New Jerusalem image again
         here. Rev. 21:16 provides precise measurements for the heavenly city (cf. Ezek. 48:16), using three of
         the same terms as Ephesians, length, breadth and height, which are all equal and measure 1500 miles
         in each direction....strange to say, [there are] four, not three, spatial dimensions of the heavenly
         city: it is a perfect cube (like the Holy of Holies, 1 Kgs 6:20), plus an underneath layer (a ‘depth’) of
         apostolic foundations.364 (Emphasis his.)

        Paul was “not permitted to speak” frankly of his visit to that City, but perhaps he is dropping a clue here.
After all, in 1Cor 2:10, he says that the things that are prepared by God for those who love Him, which would
certainly include New Jerusalem, are revealed by the Spirit, and he uses an allegory to contrast “the Mount Sinai in
Arabia” with “the Jerusalem above” (Gal 4:25-26). Since the former is literal, the presumption should be that the
latter is real also. We are expected, in Paul’s mind, to be able to derive spiritual truths from these literal cities. And
Paul expects us to set our minds on things above (Col 3:1). The Heavenly City and the hyperspace in which it
resides would surely be included in such an exhortation. Plus, Jesus said that it is given to His followers to know
the mysteries of the kingdom (Mt 13:10-11). The details of the Heavenly City would be a part of those mysterious
hidden truths that are revealed to those who faithfully search them out as part of their kingly preparation (Ps 25:2).
        In any event, John was permitted to speak of his visit to this Heavenly Jerusalem, and the precise

      John Muddiman, Ephesians, BNTC, s.v. Eph 3:18.
Chapter 7. New Jerusalem as the Bride                                                                       Page 287
measurements he provides for the City indicate a spatial reality, not mere imaginary imagery. If the mention of the
foundations suggests the fourth-dimensional nature of this City, whose other three dimensions were already given,
then one is left to speculate that WH may have had something of this nature in mind as well when he specified that
the 3D City has an extra dimension, a foundation (Heb 11:10).

      5D Superspace
                                            Illustration 108. Superspace




       Superstring theory was created to explain the smallest particles and forces. In like manner, I am posing my
own version of superspace theory to explain the largest space and forces and the dynamic relation between
supernatural and natural intelligences. Contrary to the popular persuasion that God exists outside of time, I
believe He exists in a superspacetime continuum that permeates the hyperspacetime continuum in which angels and
the 4D City reside, which in turn permeates the spacetime continuum in which humans and the Earth reside.365
       Our spacetime continuum has three spatial dimensions and one temporal dimension. We discuss it in terms
of a spacetime fabric that can be bent. Lake has an interesting unification chart of superstring theory and the Bible.
As noted in MMP2, Lake poses that hyperspace composes seven higher spatial dimensions beyond the three spatial
levels of our first heaven. He also poses a subspace dimension (which you might think of as the basement in which
time runs slower than our dimension). Additionally, he poses that time runs uniformly through all spatial
dimensions, but that time is experienced differently at the higher dimensions.366 He may be correct regarding the
subspacetime continuum. In any event, in my assessment, posing a superspacetime continuum is both intuitive and
theologically necessary. If God wishes, He can create as many 4D Multiverses as He wants in superspace and thus
turn His 5D Universe into a 5D Multiverse, and we could travel between the 4D Multiverses by teleporting through
5D superspace. After all, “heaven and the highest heaven cannot contain” God (1Kgs 8:27). Therefore, we can
safely deduce that our 3D Universe and its 4D Multiverse do not contain God. They are but a part of the higher 5D
Universe in which God lives. Nevertheless, since I see no need for God to create additional 4D Multiverses, I will
merely leave that 5D-Multiverse option on the table. At any rate, our 4D Multiverse has its own hyperspacetime
fabric. And God’s 5D Universe has its own superspacetime fabric.

                                          Illustration 109. 5D View of 4D




       For reasons explained in POV and as recapped below in Illustration 113. Timeless Eternal Now Versus
Eternal Time (p. 297), my preference is to use timelines to picture God as existing outside of our time but not
outside of time altogether. Reasoning by analogy leads to the same conclusion. Earthlings are 3D beings who reside
in 3D space. Angels are a higher order of beings, namely 4D beings, who reside in 4D hyperspace. In turn, since
(1) angels were created in the image of God and since (2) humans were created in the image of both God and angels
(see MSIH), it stands to reason that God is a higher order of being, presumably at least a 5D being, who resides in
5D superspace. As such, standing in His 5D Universe, Jesus can take a 5D view of 4D angels, the 4D Lake of Fire,
and of our 4D Multiverse with its internal 3D universes.
       Dimensionally, angels are higher beings than us because they natively operate in the 4th dimension while we
only natively operate in the 3rd dimension. They are native to the 4th dimension, while we a native to the 3rd
dimension. Our design and nature are tied ontologically to our dimensionality. Reasoning by analogy would
lead us to think that because God is likewise superior to angels, He natively exists and operates in a higher dimension
to them. Accordingly, the above illustration perceives Jesus as standing in a 5th dimension where He can see the
lower dimensions. We would reasonably infer that the Lord, by nature, is ontologically at least a 5th-degree being.
       “According to His promise we are looking for new heavens and a new earth, in which righteousness dwells”
(2Pet 3:13). I do not believe that the Lake of Fire will be in the same space or hyperspace as that occupied by the
New Heavens and New Earth in the eternal state. Nor do I believe that the Lake of Fire will be in the subspace of
the New Heavens and New Earth. The Lake of Fire will not be in our basement, so to speak. Instead, I believe the
Lake of Fire is outside the Kingdom of Heaven and thus outside our 4D Universe, thus outside the multiverse. All
sin will be removed from our 4D Universe and moved to this 4D prison. In the eternal state, redeemed humanity
might be able to view the Lake of Fire via a teleportal if the Lake of Fire is viewable outside of Earthly Jerusalem,
as some believe.
Chapter 7. New Jerusalem as the Bride                                                                       Page 289
       By the way, if I am correct that the Lake of Fire is outside the 4D Kingdom of Heaven (thus outside our 4D
Multiverse) and that we can view the Lake of Fire from within our kingdom, then we have proof of a 5D dimension.
Teleportals travel through a higher dimension. For example, a wormhole from one area in our 3D universe to another
area in our 3D universe is a tunnel that must travel through hyperspace, thus through 4D space. Accordingly, if 4D
beings in our 4D Universe are to be able to view those in the Lake of Fire, they will have to be able to view them
through a teleportal that optically travels like a wormhole tunnel through 5D superspace.
       In the illustration above, I have pictured Jesus as standing in this 5D superspace. The Bride will co-rule with
Him. Nonetheless, I do not believe that Jesus can raise the Bride completely to His level. Ontologically, God must
remain the uppermost Elohim. Perceiving Him as existing at least one plane higher than the Bride seems to be
theologically necessary. One might speculate that God can move up into another dimension if He moves the Bride
up to His current dimension. Yet that supposition is confounded by the biblical propositions about the immutability
of God’s changeless nature, such as, “Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today, yes and forever” (Heb 13:8).
“For I, the Lord, do not change” (Mal 3:6). Ontology seems to be intrinsically interconnected with
dimensionality.
       Thus, we would not expect that the Lord can change His intrinsic dimensionality. That a 4D being can interact
with 3D beings is a given. Angels do it all the time. Even so, doing so does not change their essential nature, only
their external form. Accordingly, by analogy, we can reason that the Lord Jesus, as a 5th-dimensional being, can
take the form of a 4D angel, namely, the Angel of the Lord, and He can take the form of a 3D human, namely, Jesus
of Nazareth. Proposing that God will remain at level 5D, rather than move up in His essential dimensionalities while
moving the Bride to the highest level of 4D reality of which She is capable, is entirely reasonable and logistically
satisfying. In short, we could be content with the proposition that the Lord is 5D and will elevate the Bride to the
highest degree of 4D. Notwithstanding, at least for theoretical considerations, further possibilities are worthy of
mentioning.

       6D Supernalspace
       At a minimum, Jesus is a 5th-dimensional being. But He could be higher. Why not allow the possibility that
He can elevate the Bride to being a 5th-dimensional being if He is a higher order of being than 5D? After all, would
it not make sense for Him to do so if He could? And if He could, would He not do so? All things are possible for
God (Mk 10:47; 14:36). What I am posing certainly seems to fall within that category of possibility. And if it is a
possibility, then certain considerations lead me to consider it a probability.
Misthological Models Part 5                                                                                   Page 290
                                          Illustration 110. 6D View of 5D




        In the illustration above, the 5D Bride is viewing the 4D angels and 4D Multiverse below, while Jesus is
standing above, outside that 5D time, seeing both the 5D Bride and the 4D reality She is seeing. Quite plausibly,
God could make the Bride a 5D being if He is a 6D being. The Bride is, after all, ontologically a higher order of
being than the angels. Perhaps She will simply be the highest order of 4D being that God can create. Yet, as was
just noted, ontology seems to be intrinsically intertwined with dimensionality. Since the Bride of Christ is
ontologically superior to angels, She probably more fully shares God’s nature in terms of dimensionality
than angels. She not only has something angels do not have—a regenerate nature (God’s nature)—She has this
nature at an elevated misthological status that is higher than the rest of regenerate humanity. Surely, the Bride, as a
first-tier elohim, will have a nature that is further ontologically and dimensionally elevated than all other regenerate
humanity. For instance, She would not only be able to view 4D realities from this 5D vantage point without the aid
of a wormhole, but She would also be able to create 4D realities, if she wished, from this 5D dimensional advantage
point. Her ontological superiority argues powerfully for dimensional superiority, which, in turn, suggests that the
Lord is actually at least a 6D being. After all, the Lord must be at least one level higher than the Bride. Bridal
believers will be like Him but not identical to Him (1Jn 3:2).
Chapter 7. New Jerusalem as the Bride                                                                       Page 291
                            Illustration 111. Basic 6D View of 5D from Supernalspace




       Following through on the probable inference that Jesus is at least a 6D being, we can picture Jesus as standing
in a 6D dimension in which He sees the Bride in Her 5D reality. After all, He must have somewhere to stand outside
Her dimension since He is not limited to Her dimensionality.367 He would be in a higher dimension from which He
can view and access Her dimensionality.
       The proposition that the Bride’s nature is ontologically and misthologically superior to angels and the rest of
regenerate humanity is deductively certain (see DOLF and IMOC). Consequently, the proposition that Her nature
is dimensionally superior to angels is reasonable. At this point in the discussion, then, reasoning just from these
premises, my conjecture is that God is a 6th-dimensional being and the only 6th-dimensional being that can exist
and that He exists in the highest level of the spacetime continuum possible—6D supernalspace (to coin my own
term). When the Bride is completed, She will probably be transformed into a 5th-dimensional being and dwell in
superspace. Accordingly, my conjecture is that the Bride will be a 5th-dimensional being and the only 5D being
that can exist. Either at the beginning of the millennial age or at the end of the millennial age, God will probably
elevate Her to a 5D status.
       If this is the case, which seems likely, then God planned this dimensional upgrade from the beginning. Being
at least a 6th-dimensional being, God created 4D angels and eventually 3D humans with the anticipation of creating
the 5D Bride to be the most compatible being for Himself. With Paul, I say, “Oh, the depth of the riches both of the
wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable are His judgments and unfathomable His ways!” (Rom 11:33).
Posing 6th-degree ontology and dimensionality for God and a 5th-degree ontology and dimensionality for the Bride
is not logistically necessary to accommodate an infinitely expanding humanity. Nevertheless, various biblical
inferences suggest that at least a 6th-degree ontology and dimensionality for God and a corresponding 5th-degree

and experienced in these infinite locations at one time. Likewise, I suspect that what is true of higher dimensional
buildings can be true of higher dimensional beings. The Lord, as a higher-class dimensional being, can replicate
Himself in an infinite number of lower-class dimensional representations and be in as many lower
dimensional locations as He desires. He has joined His infinite divine nature with our finite human nature in
such a way to be able to be in multiple locations at one time.368 Therefore, He can sit down to dinner with as
many of His bridal saints as He wishes at one time in different locations of the 4D City. Could He have not devised

       7D Ultraspace
       The objection might be raised, though, that 4D angels do not seem to be able to replicate themselves in 3D
reality in this manner. One rejoinder I would pose is that God may have put a damper on their ability to replicate
when He created them. Alternatively, for finite sentient beings to manifest themselves in multiple lower-
dimensional locations at once, I would hypothesize that they must be at least two levels higher than the lower
dimension in which they wish to make multiple manifestations.369 If so, I would pose that God is an infinite 7th
degree being who will transform the Bride into a finite 6th-degree being so that she can perform a finite version of
seemingly being omnipresent. Additionally, I will adopt this limited bridal self-replication as my working
hypothesis since six is the number of man (who was created on the sixth day) and seven represents God (who
rested on the seventh day, possibly thereby indicating His dimensional nature).370 The Bride will presumably
be made a finite 6th-dimensional being who can manifest Herself in as many 4D and 3D locations as She
desires. After all, She is to be as much like Her Lord as possible, and what I am posing seems certainly within the
realm of possibility. Have you ever wished that you could be in two places at once? Of course, you have. The
problem is that, as a finite 3D being, you can only be in one location at one time. My conjecture is that finite bridal
saints will be able to be in as many 4D or 3D locations as they wish because they will be at least two levels higher
than those locations. Granted, the things I am posing are things that “eye has not seen and ear has not heard, and
which have not entered the heart of man, all that God has prepared for those who love Him” (1Cor 2:9).
Nevertheless, if it has entered my heart that this expectation is a reasonable reward for the Bride, do we really think
that the ultimate reality will be anything less spectacular? I do not believe in macro biological evolution, but I do
believe in misthological, ontological, and dimensional evolution. And this is as high as I presently can reasonably
project us evolving.

    My hypothesis as to why finite creatures would have to be two dimensions higher stems from analogy. Humans

seemingly independent thought. Presumably, angels can mentally multitask for similar reasons. If so, they have 5D
brains that allow them to multitask in lower dimensions. They could place copies of themselves in 3D, but it would

functional autonomous copies of Herself. Dissociate identity disorder (aka multiple personality disorder) is the
opposite of what I am posing—singular associative identity multiplication—in which the individual can multiply
physical manifestations of himself or herself that seemingly operate autonomously yet, behind the scenes, with the
collective consciousness of a singular personality.
      We might liken it to artificial intelligence (AI). Imagine an AI computer that can replicate itself by creating
other AIs that share its personality and seemingly act independently while really acting in unity. Just as the Jesus
who can sit down to dinner simultaneously with as many bridal overcomers as He wishes and interact with them
personally and individually is the same Jesus setting at all these tables, so bridal overcomers will be able to do the
same. They do not lose their individuality or personality in their multiplicity.

is probably a 7th-dimensional being who can be omnipresent because His body can operate at the same level as His
mind. The primary difference is that the Bride remains finite while the Lord remains infinite. Since He is infinite,
He can be truly omnipresent. Since She is finite, She can only be semi-omnipresent.

above them. Induction would lead to the same conclusion for the Bride. We will be as much like Him as possible
(1Jn 3:2).
       Having Christ in us is our hope of glory (Col 1:27). Yet this hope is seminal (cp. Rom 5:2). Having Christ in
us gives us the capacity to become like Him in our character so that we may become like Him in our radiance. If
we grow to be Christlike in our character, we will shine like Him in splendor. As stated in IMOC, a diamond cannot
be made without pressure, and a pearl cannot be made without pain. God is making us into a priceless pearl formed
from the internal pain we have endured. We must cherish these opportunities to suffer and fight. We only have a
very brief window of opportunity to develop a beautiful, godly character through suffering and fighting. If we are
victorious, we will have tremendous internal glory: “For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not
worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed in (eis) us” (Rom 8:18; cp. vv. 8:17b,21). This glory
to be revealed in us is the revealing of the glory of the beauty of faithful believers (GNTC).371 Having Christ in us
gives us this seminal capacity.372

       Related comments can be made about the escape in Lk 21:36. If you are not worthy of the escape, escaping
one form of God’s judgment does not mean that you have escaped from all relevant forms of God’s judgment.
Sooner or later, His judgment is going to catch up with you; you will not escape (Rom 2:3; 1Thess 5:3; Heb 2:3;
12:25). Escaping God’s frying pan only to jump into God’s fire is not worthy of being called an escape from God’s
judgment. The question facing those who face the tribulation is not simply, “Did you escape?” For the ultimate
answer to that question will be, “Were you worthy of the escape?” Not all who are raptured will escape the judgment
to come, and not all who survive until the end of the tribulation will truly have escaped from the judgment to come.
The tribulation is but a temporal judgment from which one may escape (either by rapture or surviving) without
escaping God’s eternal judgment. See RBVGB for the full development of the thesis that only bridal saints have
glorified bodies. For example, as noted therein, when Christ appears and believers are transformed into immortal
bodies, many of these transformed believers will be put to shame. “When He appears” (1Jn 2:28; 3:2), they will all
see Him, but some will fail to become like Him (1Jn 3:2), as indicated by their being put away in shame from before
Him (1Jn 2:28; cp. Ps 1:5; Mk 8:38; Lk 9:26; Jude 1:24). Thus, some will not be glorious like Him. The imagery of
this truth is most vivid in Rev 3:18, where transformed believers are ashamed of their misthological nakedness
because they are walking about in the raw—completely devoid of white garments, just as Jesus anticipated
(Mt 22:12). They do not shine at all. Therefore, their bodies would be described as immortal and imperishable but
not glorious. Not all believers will see the Father, and 1Jn 3:1-2 is talking about the Father. Nevertheless, since this
view of God in 1Jn 3:2 apparently includes seeing Jesus, as suggested by appear (phaneroo) in both 1Jn 2:28 and
3:2, a dual soteric-mistholic interpretation may be preferable: All children of God will see Jesus and be like Him in
regard to being sinless (cp. 1Jn 3:5ff), but only faithful children of God will see the Father and be like Jesus in terms
of being glorious (cp. 1Jn 2:28).
373
    OT saints believed in the physical resurrection (Job 19:25-27; Ps 16:10-11; 17:15; 21:6; 49:7-9; 15; 73:24; 103:4;
Prov 15:24; 24:16; Is 25:8; 26:19; Jer 30:9; Jon 2:6; Dan 12:2,13; Eze 34:23-24; 37:24-25; 37:10[?]; Hos 3:5).
Though some commentaries would object to including promises of David’s resurrection among the list, I include

Dan 12:2. For inclusion of the Proverb passages and some of the Psalm passages, see my article, “Resurrection and

to have misthological pertinency as well, not just temporality. Like some other OT prophets, David believed that

        Believing in the Promised Redeemer (the Messiah) for a physical resurrection has soteriological implications
(Jn 11:24-27). “Martha knew from the Old Testament that there would be a resurrection from the dead” (McGee,
TTBC). “Martha knew, as all OT saints did, that someday in the future God will raise the believing dead so that
they will physically be present to take part in the Messiah’s eternal kingdom on earth” (Wilkin, GNTC). John links
believing in the physical resurrection with believing that Jesus is the Christ, which is reasonable, given the OT
attestation of the physical resurrection. Since Sadducees did not believe in the resurrection (Mt 22:23; Mk 12:18;
Lk 20:27; Acts 23:8), they could not believe in Jesus as the Messiah, the guarantor of eternal life (inclusive of a
physical resurrection) to those who believed in Him for eternal life. Pharisees, on the other hand, affirmed the
resurrection (Acts 23:6-8). Although the resurrection in Dan 12:1-3 is mistholic (see RBVGB), the concept of a
physical resurrection in the OT laid a soteric foundation for mistholic implications.
       As noted in 4DF, the premillennial judgment being described in Dan 12:1-3, in which only some are raised,
is part of a complex of judgments taking place at the time of the Sheep and Goats Judgment described in Mt 25:31-
46. The Danielic aspect is limited to what happens to resurrected OT believers at this judgment, many of whom will
be OT Jewish believers. This judgment also will include the Jewish believers who are alive when the Lord returns
at the end of the tribulation. Hence, this Danielic judgment is predominantly a Jewish Bema, and it is appropriately
termed as such in contradistinction to the Gentile Bema (i.e., the Sheep and Goats Judgment) that occurs shortly
thereafter. Daniel is describing a premillennial resurrection of OT (predominantly Jewish) believers so that they can
be judged to determine what their status will be in the millennial kingdom. Whereas Matthew is dealing with all the
[living] nations (Gentiles) at this judgment (Mt 25:32), Daniel is focusing on the believers at this judgment,
specifically Jewish believers. A Jewish Bema is in view.
       Accordingly, Jewish believers will be resurrected and judged at the Jewish Bema. Next, Gentile believers will
be resurrected and judged at the Gentile Bema. Overlapping applicability applies, however, between the two
judgments. The Jewish Bema promises in Dan 12:2-3, although focused on Jewish believers, have applicability to
Gentile believers. The Gentile Bema promise in Mt 25:31, in turn, will have applicability to faithful Jewish
believers. In short, both Jewish and Gentile believers who overcome will shine like the sun and inherit the kingdom.
All faithful believers of all premillennial dispensations live in the Heavenly City as part of the Bride of the Lamb.
Unfaithful believers are currently in the Celestial Outer Darkness. Faithful believers are currently in the Celestial
City. After the Bema, unfaithful believers will be sent back to the Celestial Outer Darkness. Faithful believers will
continue to have their primary residence in the Bridal City.
Chapter 7. New Jerusalem as the Bride                                                                       Page 297
                           Illustration 113. Timeless Eternal Now Versus Eternal Time




       Broadly speaking, two basic approaches are available for how we view God dimensionally, thus spatially
and temporally, regarding the infamous eternal now. Either we can view God as existing outside of all time and
space (as pictured via the illustrations in the left column) in a timeless eternal now, or we can view Him as standing
in a higher dimension of time and space (as pictured via the illustrations in the right column) in eternal time. The
above illustrations contrast these basic options with a combination of summary illustrations from POV and from
herein. Contrary to the popular opinion, posed by Augustine, among others, that there was no time or place before
God created our spacetime continuum, I believe that God existed someplace, and I am calling that place ultraspace.
Rather than saying that there was nothing before God created something and that all three persons of the Godhead
could only communicate and plan internally within the Godhead and exist within themselves, I am speculating that
God existed in ultraspace and that the persons of the Godhead could communicate with each other, plan with
each other, and see each other in this place. To be sure, God exists outside our spacetime continuum and outside
its broader hyperspacetime continuum. He created both.
       Even so, I pose that, although God may be ontologically immutable in His innermost being, the mutable place
where He exists outside all created spacetime continuums is the model for all created spacetime continuums. The
ultraspacetime continuum where God currently exists has always existed if this is the case. Rather than posing that
there was no time before God created time, I would posit that time at least existed within the Godhead as the persons
Misthological Models Part 5                                                                                   Page 298
of the Trinity communicated and planned within themselves. Internal time was a part of their internal
communication. Yet, if one can pose internal time, why not allow external time. And if one can allow external time,
then one must have a place for that external time to exist.374 Hence, one derives an ultimate spacetime-continuum
(thus an ultraspacetime continuum) that existed before any created spacetime-continuum. I am coining the term
ultraspace to refer to this ultimate 7D reality.
        God apparently modeled our 3D shadows as an extension of 4D reality. Still, since not even 4D reality can
contain God, I venture that 4D hyperspace reality is a shadowy extension of His ultimate 7D reality. Since God is
light, anything He creates casts a shadow that points back to Him as its creator. Was there no space or time for
God before He created space and time? Did God exist no place because there was no place for God to exist?
Many believe that to be the case. More reasonably, in my finite mind at least, not only space and time were within
God but around God, and our spacetime reality is modeled after that ultimate reality. God is the only truly eternal
being. Our universe and multiverse are not eternal. God created both. Yet where was God when He created them?
Nowhere or somewhere? I am posing that God was somewhere. And I am calling that somewhere ultraspace.
        God describes Himself as “the One who is high and lifted up, who inhabits eternity, whose name is Holy:
‘I dwell in the high and holy place’” (Is 57:15; ESV). God’s ultimate habitation is spatial and eternal. He says so.
He lives in His own spacetime-continuum and has done so for all eternity. Oswalt (NICOT) notes the temporal and
spatial nature of this biblical claim merely in terms of what God is not: “God is not part of this world, either in time
(eternally) or space (high and holy place).” Isaiah does much better with a positive affirmation. Smith (NAC) also
makes a positive affirmation, saying that God is transcendent. Ok, but what does that mean in terms of space and
time? Constable (TCENB) acknowledges that the verse has implications for both: “He is the utterly transcendent
God in relation to space (high and lifted up, cf. 6:1; 52:13), time (lives forever).” Radmacher (NIBC) says that it
means “He transcends time itself…unsearchably high.” Such stock comments are used by many to convey the
impression that God is beyond all time and space, based on the popular premise that time does not exist in Heaven
or eternity. On the contrary, we know that time exists in both. In relation to events that happen on Earth, actions
take place in Heaven. The martyrs in Heaven are keenly aware of the passages of time and cry out: “How long, O
Lord, holy and true, wilt Thou refrain from judging and avenging our blood on those who dwell on the earth?”
(Rev 6:10). In Rev 8:1, “when He broke the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.” There
was a passage of time in Heaven. Similarly, Rev 10:5 does not mean that time will no longer exist in the eternal
state. On the contrary, it means that Heaven will no longer delay exacting its judgment on Earth. The timeless view
of God and eternity should be rejected (see POV).
        Isaiah is not saying that God dwells in timeless eternity. Jesus is the same yesterday, today, and tomorrow
(Heb 13:8). He has always dwelt in some form of time. More precisely and reasonably than the majority of
commentators, Motyer (TOTC) uses parallelism within Isaiah to state what Isaiah means: “Lives for ever: as ‘father
of eternity’ in 9:6 means ‘eternally a father’, so here ‘inhabiter of eternity’ means ‘eternally the inhabitant’.” To
be an inhabitant of eternity in Is 57:15, God must have a place to inhabit throughout eternity. God has inhabited this
place from all eternity. God describes Himself with spatial terms when He describes Himself as an inhabitant.375
God has been an inhabitant of someplace before He created anyplace. Barnes (BNONT) is superior in his
assessment: “It seems to be used to denote the elevated place of an eternal dwelling” (italics his). Ultraspace is
this elevated space that is in an eternally higher dimension than all created space.
        This basic concept is not complex. As I was adding this exegetical note, I asked my wife, Dianne, “Where
was God before He created anything?” She immediately responded, “Well, He had to be somewhere.” Her lay
intuition on this occasion was superior to the prevailing popular scholarly speculation. Take a related statement in
Ps 22:3, where David says that God inhabits the praise of His people (KJV). Does David mean that God is nowhere
to be found when we praise Him? Of course not! God experiences the praises from our time in His time, and He is
also spatially present: “God is present and glorified when His people lift His name in honor. God enjoys it—perhaps

        Like others, Constable rightly cites Is 6:1 as parallel to Is 57:15: “I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, lofty and
exalted, with the train of His robe filling the temple.” Isaiah could see the Lord sitting somewhere—in an eternal
realm. Being seated in eternity does not mean being nowhere. It means to be spatially present in that eternal realm.
Reymond likewise cites Is 6:1 as a parallel, yet he says, “Being ‘high and lofty’ means, at the very least, that God
who is “spirit, infinite, eternal, and unchangeable in his being, wisdom, power, holiness, justice, goodness, and
truth,” is above us, infinitely above us!” (Emphasis his.)377 Using these passages to say that God is infinitely above
us is counterintuitive. Are angels infinitely above us? No. God created man a little lower than the gods, that is, a
little lower than the angels who comprise the divine council (Ps 8:5; Heb 2:7). Yet such angels are around God’s
throne. So being seated on this throne and standing around this throne does not put them infinitely above us. It
simply puts them in a higher dimension, probably a fourth dimension as opposed to our third dimension. However,
just as Jesus could simultaneously be in the fourth dimension while being in our third dimension (Jn 3:13, MT), I
deduce that God can simultaneously be in the 7D realm while seated on His heavenly throne in the 4D realm
surrounded by His 4D angels. Spatially, perceiving God as being infinitely above us in the nth dimension is highly
questionable, perhaps objectionable. Speculating that God is in a 7th-degree dimension is much more sensible.
        Reymond’s grasp of what it means for God to inhabit eternity is insightful:

              Can you grasp this truth? Have you ever tried to define “time,” not to mention attempting to
       define “eternity”? My senior colleague in the department of systematic theology at Covenant
       Theological Seminary in St. Louis, Missouri for some years was Dr. J. Oliver Buswell, Jr., who
       religiously required his students year after year to memorize his definition of time and eternity. “Time”
       he said, “is the mere abstract (or ideational) possibility of the before and after relationship in durational
       sequence,” and eternity is simply “infinite time,” that is, time (so defined) extrapolated in both
       directions to infinity.378

       Exactly! Eternity is not timeless. Rather, it is infinite time. God existed infinitely in time before us.379
Here, the word infinitely is a good fit. Even here, though, it is not extrapolated to mean timelessness, as if God exists
outside of time. Instead, however far back in time we go, God existed before that time. Likewise, even if God does
exist infinitely above us spatially, this should not be taken to mean that He exists no place, as if He is non-spatial.
Rather, regardless of how high we may go, God is still higher. If we can obtain to the 6th dimension, then God’s
ultimate dimension is at least one dimension higher, that is, in the 7th dimension.380

not fitting for humans, who by regeneration partake of a 4th-degree regenerate nature, to worship angels, who

Bride (Rev 3:9).383 Therefore, the Bride is, most reasonably, a higher dimensional being than these 4D
creatures who worship Her, probably two dimensions higher, a 6D being.

    To express this abstraction in concrete terms and using all caps for GOD, as in Illustration 95. Multiple-Tiered
Elohim (p. 261), to denote our supreme 7th-dimensional creator, let us suppose that GOD places a monogamous
couple as soulmates (see MSIH) in charge of a planet, called Falconia, in the center of one of the universes in the

nature would prevent him from desiring to be worshipped as GOD or allowing himself to be worshipped as GOD.
In fact, since the Falcon finds sin repulsive, he would find the notion of being worshipped as GOD repulsive.

       Vacation Space
       If my conjectures are correct that God moves the Bride from being a 4th-dimensional being to a 6th-
dimensional being and that the 4D City remains only 4D, then the question naturally arises as to what will occupy
5D superspace. The pure speculation on my part is that God might create a nuptial chamber there for the Bride when
He makes Her a 6D being. This 5D halfway point would be a place where the Lord could meet with bridal believers
apart from the business affairs associated with 4D commerce, thus in a place and time outside of that 4D place and
time, a getaway cabin, so to speak, a vacation cabin. Otherwise, I am left to think that the 5D dimension will be
skipped over as unused, which seems rather useless. The 4D City will remain Her residence and the hub of
commerce for multiverse trade, dubbed herein as Hub City. And the 3D New Jerusalem will remain Her primary
means of commercial interaction with New Earth. Still, God expresses interest in showing us how to rest and have
feast days. If these feasts are models for what He will show us in the future, I think it sensible to make a place for
such a possibility in my model.
       Jesus told the twelve, “‘Come away by yourselves to a lonely place and rest a while.’ (For there were many
people coming and going, and they did not even have time to eat.) And they went away in the boat to a lonely place
by themselves” (Mk 6:31-32). If the Lord is the same yesterday, today, and forever (and surely He is, Heb 13:8),
He would still be interested in us getting away by ourselves with Him on occasion. Perhaps the 5th dimension will
be that lonely place where we can get away from it all and be with the Lord and rest awhile. His earthly plans were
foiled at that time because “the people saw them going, and many recognized them, and they ran there together on
foot from all the cities, and got there ahead of them” (Mk 6:33). Any such heavenly getaway trips in the future will
not be foiled because the Lord and Bride will be the only beings able to access the 5th-dimensional getaway or any
5th-dimensional objects they create therein. And if my speculation is correct, that the Bride can only replicate
Herself in dimensions at least two levels below Her, She would be unable to replicate Herself in the 5th dimension.
She would not be able to multitask multidimensionally if taken there. Any time spent there with the Lord would be
apart from other distractions. The 3D cities and 4D City will be a place of commerce. I am making allowance for
the possibility that the Lord may make it possible for us to get away from all forms of city and City distractions on
occasions. Who knows? The Lord might even cut off anything analogous to cell phone service in the 5th dimension
to make it a true getaway-from-it-all, a true time and place for vacation. If God is a 7D being who modeled rest for
us by resting on the 7th day, then perhaps He will have us take periods of rest with Him in the 5th dimension. And
since time is elastic, we can spend all the time we want there while no time has passed in the lower dimensions. We
will be able to have all the rest we want and all the commerce we want, practically simultaneously from 4D and 3D
vantage points.
       While musing on how the 3D City is replicated throughout the multiverse, I received an inquiry from Keith
Call, asking, “If the New Jerusalem IS the bride, is it possible that the City not only houses the bridal class, but its
very atomic structure is somehow comprised of its inhabitants as well? Does their effulgence, regal status, or very
essence as living souls somehow provide the actual solidity of the New Jerusalem?”384 Because of passages like
Eph 2:22 and 1Pet 2:5, I had wondered something similar myself. How is it that we are living stones being built
together as a dwelling of God in the Spirit? Out of sheer conjecture, I will venture the suggestion that when the
Bride is complete, She will be made into a 5D Bridal City that will make possible the 3D replicas being postulated
herein. As a habitation of 4D angels, the current Heavenly City could never rise to a higher level than 4D. However,
as a habitation of a 6D Bride, the current Heavenly City would easily be raised to the 5D level, which only she
could inhabit at that higher level. The 3D replicas would be like guest rooms in the 5D House. To be consistent, if
God were to create multiple 4D Cities in 4D Multiverses, then I would pose that possibility—of the Bride composing
a 6D House that could be replicated as 4D Cities. At present, though, since the beauty of the 6D Bride is to exceed
the previous perfection of the 4D Lucifer, I pose that Jesus is presently preparing a 5D Heavenly City that will far
exceed the beauty of the 4D Heavenly City that was inhabited by Lucifer. Surely, the Lord will have something
better than a hand-me-down City to offer His Bride. Yes, She will have a residence in the 4D City and the 3D New
Jerusalem from where She can interact with Her 4D and 3D subjects. However, Her getaway castle will be far
greater than anything we can imagine—a 5D Heavenly City—only accessible by Her and Her Lord.
